translated: He is called that because he has the array of emanations of the noble Yamantaka, by which he conquers the demon of death that exists in the mental continuum of all sentient beings.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis 'pham par bya ba mi nus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyis mi thub @238a * //🔽pa'o ; / rdo rje gyes pa mche ba gtsigs //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis 'pham par bya ba mi nus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyis mi thub @238a * // pa'o ; / rdo rje gyes pa mche ba gtsigs //
translated: He is called Aparajita because he cannot be defeated by afflictions.🔽He has a vajra-frown and bared fangs.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje gyes pa bsnams pa dang / mche ba drag tu gtsigs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje gyes pa bsnams pa dang / mche ba drag tu gtsigs pa'o //
translated: He has a vajra-frown and bared fangs.

original: gang la 'phags pa gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rdo rje bkod pa rnams kyis sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i bdud rnam par gzhom par bya ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la 'phags pa gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rdo rje bkod pa rnams kyis sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i bdud rnam par gzhom par bya ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is called that because he has the array of emanations of the noble Aparajita-vajra, by which he conquers the demon of afflictions of sentient beings.

original: dpal sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rgyud las bshad pa'i rta mchog bzhin du tshangs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi phung po'i bdud la sogs pa rab tu 'joms pa'i phyir rdo rje rta ste dpal padma mthar byed yin zhing de'o //
analyzed: dpal sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rgyud las bshad pa'i rta mchog bzhin du tshangs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi phung po'i bdud la sogs pa rab tu 'joms pa'i phyir rdo rje rta ste dpal padma mthar byed yin zhing de'o //
translated: As explained in the Tantra of All the Buddhas, he is the glorious Horse-head, because he completely conquers the demon of the aggregates in the form of Brahma, etc.

original: padma mthar byed gang gis rnam pa thams cad du gdug pa'i phung po'i bdud kyi rang bzhin can tshangs pa gnon pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: padma mthar byed gang gis rnam pa thams cad du gdug pa'i phung po'i bdud kyi rang bzhin can tshangs pa gnon pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is the glorious Padmanartaka, because he tramples on Brahma, who is of the nature of the demon of the aggregates, in all his aspects.

original: gang la rta bskyed pa dang de las byung ba'i bkod pa rnams kyis phung po'i bdud rnam par gzhom par bya ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //🔽rdo rje mi 'chi ni bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'o //
analyzed: gang la rta bskyed pa dang de las byung ba'i bkod pa rnams kyis phung po'i bdud rnam par gzhom par bya ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o // rdo rje mi 'chi ni bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'o //
translated: He is so called because he has the means of completely destroying the demon of the aggregates by means of the array of the horse-generated ones and the ones generated from him.🔽Vajra-amrta is Amrta-kundali.

original: rdo rje'i sprin ni kun tu 'khrug / ces bya ba ni ye shes kyi 'od zer gyi sprin gyis khyab pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sprin ni kun tu 'khrug / ces bya ba ni ye shes kyi 'od zer gyi sprin gyis khyab pa'o //
translated: The vajra-cloud is agitated means pervaded by the cloud of the light-rays of gnosis.

original: gang la bdud rtsi 'khyil pa las byung ba'i rdo rje'i dam tshig bkod pa rnams kyis lha'i bu'i bdud rnam par gzhom par bya ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la bdud rtsi 'khyil pa las byung ba'i rdo rje'i dam tshig bkod pa rnams kyis lha'i bu'i bdud rnam par gzhom par bya ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He who has the Vajra Vows arisen from Amṛtakuṇḍali, by which he conquers the Māra of the Sons of the Gods, is so called.

original: rdo rje 'od bzang zhes bya ba ni dpal zhe sdang rdo rje'i mdog can no //
analyzed: rdo rje 'od bzang zhes bya ba ni dpal zhe sdang rdo rje'i mdog can no //
translated: Vajra-surocana means the color of glorious Dveṣavajrā.

original: bsam gtan nyid rdo rje yin pas na bsam gtan rdo rje'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan nyid rdo rje yin pas na bsam gtan rdo rje'o //
translated: Dhyāna is a vajra, thus dhyānavīra.

original: des rdzogs par byang chub pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par sbyor ba las byung ba'i bde ba chen po ste /
analyzed: des rdzogs par byang chub pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par sbyor ba las byung ba'i bde ba chen po ste /
translated: He who is perfected by that, i.e., by the great bliss arisen from correct union,

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la ming de skad ces bya ba nyid yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la ming de skad ces bya ba nyid yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: is so called because he has that samādhi called by that name.

original: zhags pa 'dzin ces bya ba ni phyag gsum pas rig ma'i nu ma 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhags pa 'dzin ces bya ba ni phyag gsum pas rig ma'i nu ma 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He who holds the noose means he who holds the breasts of the knowledge-woman with his third hand.

original: gang la sku dang gsung dang thugs mi phyed pa'i stobs yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la sku dang gsung dang thugs mi phyed pa'i stobs yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He who has the power of indivisible body, speech, and mind is so called.

original: rgya mtsho nag po skyed par byed //
analyzed: rgya mtsho nag po skyed par byed //
translated: He generates the black ocean.

original: ces bya ba ni rgya mtsho rnams kyi chu'i khams bzhin du 'phags pa dbyig pa sngon po sku mdog nag po skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rgya mtsho rnams kyi chu'i khams bzhin du 'phags pa dbyig pa sngon po sku mdog nag po skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: This is the water element of the oceans, which generates the noble Nīladaṇḍa, who is black in color.

original: gang la rdo rje dbyig pa nyid 'da' bar mi bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dam tshig mchog yin pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la rdo rje dbyig pa nyid 'da' bar mi bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dam tshig mchog yin pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is called the supreme commitment, since he is the commitment that the vajra staff should not be transgressed.

original: rdo rje'i nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dam tshig ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'phags pa mi g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dam tshig ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'phags pa mi g-yo ba ste /
translated: The commitment of the vajra realm of space is the noble Acalanātha, who is non-abiding nirvāṇa.

original: gang la des srid pa dang zhi ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i zhabs 'joms @238b par byed pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la des srid pa dang zhi ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i zhabs 'joms @238b par byed pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is called that, since he has the power to destroy the feet of the concepts of existence and peace.

original: rig pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: The wheel of knowledge is the uṣṇīṣa Cakravartin.

original: gtsug tor nyid dam tshig ste /
analyzed: gtsug tor nyid dam tshig ste /
translated: The uṣṇīṣa is the commitment,

original: 'da' bar mi bya ba nyid yin zhing gang la de'i stobs kyi rig pa'i 'khor lo mi shigs pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'da' bar mi bya ba nyid yin zhing gang la de'i stobs kyi rig pa'i 'khor lo mi shigs pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: since it should not be transgressed. He is called that, since he has the indestructible wheel of knowledge by its power.

original: rdo rje sum bha zhes bya ba ni dpal gnod mdzes rgyal po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sum bha zhes bya ba ni dpal gnod mdzes rgyal po'o //
translated: The one called Vajra Sumhbha is glorious Bhairava, the king.

original: 'di ni khro bo thams cad kyis //
analyzed: 'di ni khro bo thams cad kyis //
translated: This is the pledge of all wrathful ones

original: 'da' bar dka' ba'i dam tshig go //
analyzed: 'da' bar dka' ba'i dam tshig go //
translated: that is difficult to transgress.

original: zhes bya ba ni khro bo thams cad bsgom pa'i rnam par 'di nyid ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khro bo thams cad bsgom pa'i rnam par 'di nyid ni /
translated: This very form of meditation on all wrathful ones

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis kyang 'da' bar bya ba ma yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis kyang 'da' bar bya ba ma yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: is said by the Blessed One to be difficult to transgress even by all the transcendent ones.

original: gang la rdo rje'i dam tshig nyid dpal gnod mdzes rgyal po ste de rab tu 'byung ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la rdo rje'i dam tshig nyid dpal gnod mdzes rgyal po ste de rab tu 'byung ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The one who has the pledge of the vajra, glorious Bhairava, the king, is called that.

original: gang gi tshe rang gi rigs su bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshogs sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams ma grub na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang gi rigs su bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshogs sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams ma grub na /
translated: When the assembly of mandalas explained in one's own family, such as the buddhas, are not accomplished,

original: de'i tshe dkyil 'khor rnams bka'i 'khor los mnan nas bsgrubs na gdon mi za bar 'grub par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de'i tshe dkyil 'khor rnams bka'i 'khor los mnan nas bsgrubs na gdon mi za bar 'grub par 'gyur bas /
translated: then, when the mandalas are suppressed by the wheel of command and accomplished, they will certainly be accomplished.

original: de'i phyir 'gog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the suppression, etc. is explained.

original: 'gog pa ni mnan pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni mnan pa'o //
translated: Suppression is subduing.

original: gang gis she na khro bo'i 'khor los te /
analyzed: gang gis she na khro bo'i 'khor los te /
translated: By what? By the wheel of wrath.

original: khro bo'i dkyil 'khor 'bar bas so //
analyzed: khro bo'i dkyil 'khor 'bar bas so //
translated: By the blazing mandala of wrath.

original: 'di gang gis bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gang gis bya zhe na /
translated: By whom?

original: sangs rgyas 'khor lo bstan pas te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'khor lo bstan pas te /
translated: By the teaching of the wheel of the buddhas.

original: 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas shing sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor sgom pa pos so //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas shing sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor sgom pa pos so //
translated: By one who has actualized the concentration of cessation and meditates on the mandala of the buddhas, etc.

original: gang las she na 'di ltar /
analyzed: gang las she na 'di ltar /
translated: From what?

original: ting 'dzin rdo rje sems dpa' rnams //
analyzed: ting 'dzin rdo rje sems dpa' rnams //
translated: Thus, the vajra-concentrations of the bodhisattvas

original: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor las 'grub 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor las 'grub 'gyur // zhes gsungs te /
translated: are accomplished from the vajra-mandala.

original: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor ni 'khor lo rtsibs bcu pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor ni 'khor lo rtsibs bcu pa'o //
translated: The vajra-mandala is the ten-spoked wheel.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: m'a ma k'i'i mtsho skyes su yi ge h'um las byung ba'i 'khor lo chen po 'bar ba rtsibs bcu pa kha dog kun du ser po rnam par bsgoms la /
analyzed: m'a ma k'i'i mtsho skyes su yi ge h'um las byung ba'i 'khor lo chen po 'bar ba rtsibs bcu pa kha dog kun du ser po rnam par bsgoms la /
translated: One should visualize a great blazing wheel arisen from the syllable hūṃ in the lake of Māmakī, ten-spoked, all colors, and yellow.

original: de'i lte ba'i dbus su bdag nyid ji skad bshad pa'i zhe sdang rdo rjer rnam par bsams te /
analyzed: de'i lte ba'i dbus su bdag nyid ji skad bshad pa'i zhe sdang rdo rjer rnam par bsams te /
translated: In the center of that one should visualize oneself as the previously described Acala.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par sbyor ba las kun du phyung nas /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par sbyor ba las kun du phyung nas /
translated: Having extracted them from the correct application just as it is,🔽the four spokes supported by the location of the slightly withdrawn Vairochana and so forth are the four beginning with Arya Yamantaka.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa cung zad nur ba'i gnas la brten pa'i rtsibs bzhi la 'phags pa gshin rje gshed la sogs pa bzhi po dang de bzhin du sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa cung zad nur ba'i gnas rnams su go rims bzhin du 'phags pa🔽'dod @239a * //🔽pa'i rgyal po dang dbyig pa sngon po dang / stobs po che dang / mi g-yo ba dang / dbang po dang / dbang ldan gyi phyogs kyi rtsibs dag gi dbus na gnas pa'i rtsibs cung zad par 'dor ba la khro bo gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa cung zad nur ba'i gnas la brten pa'i rtsibs bzhi la 'phags pa gshin rje gshed la sogs pa bzhi po dang de bzhin du sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa cung zad nur ba'i gnas rnams su go rims bzhin du 'phags pa 'dod @239a * // pa'i rgyal po dang dbyig pa sngon po dang / stobs po che dang / mi g-yo ba dang / dbang po dang / dbang ldan gyi phyogs kyi rtsibs dag gi dbus na gnas pa'i rtsibs cung zad par 'dor ba la khro bo gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba dang /
translated: Similarly, the four beginning with Buddha Lochana are in the slightly withdrawn locations.🔽In the middle of the spokes of the directions of Indra, Agni, Yama, and Varuna, the four beginning with Arya🔽are in the middle of the slightly withdrawn spokes.🔽In the middle of the spokes of the directions of Varuna and Nairrta, one should imagine the wrathful glorious King of Wrath Yamantaka and

original: de bzhin du chu lha dang bden bral gyi phyogs dag gi dbus na gnas pa'i rtsibs la khro bo dpal gnod mdzes rgyal po bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu lha dang bden bral gyi phyogs dag gi dbus na gnas pa'i rtsibs la khro bo dpal gnod mdzes rgyal po bsam par bya'o //
translated: the wrathful glorious King of Wrath Aparajita.

original: le'u bco brgyad pa las kyang /
analyzed: le'u bco brgyad pa las kyang /
translated: In the eighteenth chapter of the Compendium of Principles Tantra, it states:

original: 'khor lo ser po rtsibs bcu pa //
analyzed: 'khor lo ser po rtsibs bcu pa //
translated: The ten-spoked yellow wheel

original: de yi dbus na rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: de yi dbus na rnam par bsgom //
translated: is meditated in its center.

original: ye shes bcu 'byung bdag nyid can //
analyzed: ye shes bcu 'byung bdag nyid can //
translated: It is the nature of the ten-fold wisdom

original: khro bo bcu ni rtsibs kun la //
analyzed: khro bo bcu ni rtsibs kun la //
translated: and the ten wrathful ones are on all the spokes.

original: rdzogs pa mchog tu bzang ba yin //
analyzed: rdzogs pa mchog tu bzang ba yin //
translated: It is the supreme perfection, the best.

original: 'gog pa'i rdo rjes bsgom par bya'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i rdo rjes bsgom par bya'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The vajra of cessation should be meditated.

original: rdo rje'i dam tshig ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyi dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i dam tshig ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyi dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The vajra commitment is glorious Vajrasattva, whose nature is method and wisdom.

original: de'i bkod pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams tha dad pa rnams kyi dbyibs la sogs pa'i bkod pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i bkod pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams tha dad pa rnams kyi dbyibs la sogs pa'i bkod pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Its array is the nature of the array of shapes, etc. , of the different deities of the mandala.

original: des de kho na nyid kyi don bsgom pa ni yang dag par sbyor ba la gnas pa nyid kyi sgo nas las rnam pa sna tshogs bsgrub pa rnams so //
analyzed: des de kho na nyid kyi don bsgom pa ni yang dag par sbyor ba la gnas pa nyid kyi sgo nas las rnam pa sna tshogs bsgrub pa rnams so //
translated: The meditation on reality by that is the accomplishment of various kinds of activities by means of abiding in the state of union.

original: des mngon par te rnam pa thams cad du byang chub pas na mngon par byang chub pa ste /
analyzed: des mngon par te rnam pa thams cad du byang chub pas na mngon par byang chub pa ste /
translated: By that, one is manifestly enlightened, that is, enlightened in every way.

original: thams cad la khyab pa'i bde ba chen po yin zhing /
analyzed: thams cad la khyab pa'i bde ba chen po yin zhing /
translated: It is the great bliss that pervades everything.

analyzed: don de ston par byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs la de skad ces bya'o ; / le'u bcu gsum pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o / // / sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa'i sngags dgod pa dang brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs bya ba yin pas de'i phyir / sku dang gsung dang thugs rmad du byung ba'i sngags kyis 'gugs pa'i rnam par sprul pa'i rgyal po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: de'i don gyi dam tshig ni rgyu dang lam ste sangs rgyas spyan yin zhing gang la de nyid mchog rdo rje yin pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de'i don gyi dam tshig ni rgyu dang lam ste sangs rgyas spyan yin zhing gang la de nyid mchog rdo rje yin pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The pledge of its meaning is the cause and the path, which is Buddha Eye, and that which has that supreme vajra is so called.

original: sangs rgyas spyan gyi sngags brjod pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa nyid du byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas spyan gyi sngags brjod pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa nyid du byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having made the mind one-pointed by reciting the mantra of Buddha Eye, is what is meant.

original: @239b de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: @239b de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: All Ones Gone Thus is Vairochana.

original: de'i btsun mo ni sngags kyi lha mo'o //
analyzed: de'i btsun mo ni sngags kyi lha mo'o //
translated: His queen is the mantra goddess.

original: phyung ngo zhes bya ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs yang dag par sbyor ba las phyung bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phyung ngo zhes bya ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs yang dag par sbyor ba las phyung bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Extracted means that it came forth from the perfect union of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'byor ba kun la dgyes pa rnams ni sems can thams cad kyi phun sum tshogs pa la 'dod pa'i gti mug gi rigs can rnams so //
analyzed: 'byor ba kun la dgyes pa rnams ni sems can thams cad kyi phun sum tshogs pa la 'dod pa'i gti mug gi rigs can rnams so //
translated: Those who delight in all enjoyments are those who are of the type of desire and ignorance with regard to the excellence of all sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje rjes su dran //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje rjes su dran //
translated: Recollect the vajra of the buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gzugs su mngon par byung ba'i sku rdo rje ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gzugs su mngon par byung ba'i sku rdo rje ste /
translated: The vajra of the body that has arisen in the form of Buddha Eye is the vajra of the body.

original: des 'gro ba bde bar mdzad pa mngon nas mnyes shing shin tu dgyes par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des 'gro ba bde bar mdzad pa mngon nas mnyes shing shin tu dgyes par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is evident that he brings about the happiness of transmigrators, and thus he is pleased and very delighted.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhi 'byung ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhi 'byung ba //
translated: The origin of peace of the Buddhas

original: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par mngon par 'dod pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub thob nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par mngon par 'dod pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub thob nas /
translated: is the attainment of the desired power by the Tathāgatas who are desirous of accomplishing it.

original: 'dis sngar bshad pa'i rim pa bzhin du zhi bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis sngar bshad pa'i rim pa bzhin du zhi bar bya ba'o //
translated: By this, one should perform the pacification in the manner previously explained.

original: 'di nyid gdan kha dog ser po la sogs par bsam pa'i bye brag gis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las thams cad rab tu bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gdan kha dog ser po la sogs par bsam pa'i bye brag gis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las thams cad rab tu bsgrub pa'o //
translated: This very [mantra] accomplishes all the rites of pacification, etc., by the distinction of imagining the seat as yellow, etc.

original: shi ba gson par byed par gsungs //
analyzed: shi ba gson par byed par gsungs //
translated: It is said to revive the dead.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas spyan gyi rnal 'byor byas la rang gi snying ga nas grub pa'i rdo rje lcags kyu phyung ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas spyan gyi rnal 'byor byas la rang gi snying ga nas grub pa'i rdo rje lcags kyu phyung ste /
translated: One should perform the yoga of Buddhalocanā as before, and bring forth the accomplished Vajra Hook from one's heart.

original: des shi ba'i dri za'i sems can gyi bdag nyid dam mngal du zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa gsal zhing rlung gis ma bskyod pa'i mar me'i me lce'i rnam pa can bkug nas de'i snying gar bcug ste /
analyzed: des shi ba'i dri za'i sems can gyi bdag nyid dam mngal du zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa gsal zhing rlung gis ma bskyod pa'i mar me'i me lce'i rnam pa can bkug nas de'i snying gar bcug ste /
translated: Having summoned the clear consciousness of the gandharva being of death, or the consciousness of the one who has entered the womb, in the aspect of a flame of a lamp that is not moved by the wind, place it in the heart of that [being].

original: der mo ha ra ti zhes bya ba'i snying po rnam par bkod la de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs rnams kyis de'i 'jigs pa mi snang bar byas te /
analyzed: der mo ha ra ti zhes bya ba'i snying po rnam par bkod la de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs rnams kyis de'i 'jigs pa mi snang bar byas te /
translated: Having arranged the essence mantra, “moharati,” there, the mass of light rays that arise from that make the fear of that [being] disappear.

original: snying po nyid brjod cing sangs rgyas spyan gyi gzugs su yongs su gyur par bsams la /
analyzed: snying po nyid brjod cing sangs rgyas spyan gyi gzugs su yongs su gyur par bsams la /
translated: Recite the essence mantra and imagine that it completely transforms into the form of Buddha Locana.

original: phung po dang skye mched dang sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlab pa yang byas te /
analyzed: phung po dang skye mched dang sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlab pa yang byas te /
translated: Also perform the consecration of the aggregates, constituents, and sense fields, and of awakened body, speech, and mind.

original: rang gi snying gar bzhugs pa'i ye shes kyi lha mo'i thugs kar padma'i steng gi zla ba la bkod pa'i phreng ba'i sngags las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi sgo las spros pa'i sangs rgyas spyan gyi tshogs rnams kyis bum pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang bdag nyid zhugs
analyzed: rang gi snying gar bzhugs pa'i ye shes kyi lha mo'i thugs kar padma'i steng gi zla ba la bkod pa'i phreng ba'i sngags las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi sgo las spros pa'i sangs rgyas spyan gyi tshogs rnams kyis bum pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang bdag nyid zhugs
translated: The light rays emanating from the mantra string arranged on the moon seat on the lotus in the heart of the awareness goddess who resides in your heart cause a gathering of Buddhalocanīs to enter the bodhicitta in the vase and yourself.🔽

original: pa'i dbang bskur ba rnams kyis dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i dbang bskur ba rnams kyis dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: The garland mantra arranged on a moon at the heart of the awareness goddess who resides in one’s heart, which is the source of light rays, emanates a host of Buddhalocanīs, who confer empowerment with the bodhicitta of the vase and the empowerment of the one who enters oneself.

original: de ltar na shi ba de gson zhing rdo rje'i sku dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na shi ba de gson zhing rdo rje'i sku dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the dead one becomes alive and endowed with the vajra body.

original: rdo rje'i dam tshig ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' yin @240a * //
analyzed: rdo rje'i dam tshig ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' yin @240a * //
translated: The vajra commitment is glorious Vajrasattva,

original: zhing / de skul bar mdzad pas na rdo rje'i dam tshig skul mdzad ma ste /
analyzed: zhing / de skul bar mdzad pas na rdo rje'i dam tshig skul mdzad ma ste /
translated: and since she impels him, she is the one who impels the vajra commitment.

original: gang gi tshe ji skad bshad pa bzhin du byed pa'i rnal 'byor pas grub par ma gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ji skad bshad pa bzhin du byed pa'i rnal 'byor pas grub par ma gyur na /
translated: When the practitioner who acts in accordance with the above does not achieve [success],

original: de'i tshe dpal rdo rje 'chang rjes su mnyes par byas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe dpal rdo rje 'chang rjes su mnyes par byas te /
translated: then, having pleased glorious Vajradhara,

original: snyan cing 'jam pa'i tshig rnams kyis yang dag par bskul nas bkug ste de'i rgyud la grub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyan cing 'jam pa'i tshig rnams kyis yang dag par bskul nas bkug ste de'i rgyud la grub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they summon and attract by means of sweet, gentle words, and then establish them in their own continuum.

original: sku gsum gyi dam tshig rdo rje khro bo ni chos kyi sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i sgo nas 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsum gyi dam tshig rdo rje khro bo ni chos kyi sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i sgo nas 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The pledge of the three bodies is Akshobhya, who is not to be transgressed by way of being the essence of the reality body and so forth.

original: de'i dngos po ni sems can thams cad sdud par byed pa'i thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin can gyi thabs kyi thugs so //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni sems can thams cad sdud par byed pa'i thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin can gyi thabs kyi thugs so //
translated: His entity is the mind of method, which has the nature of great compassion that gathers all sentient beings.

original: de'i dngos po med pa ni de'i rang bzhin med pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: de'i dngos po med pa ni de'i rang bzhin med pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: His non-entity is the wisdom that is his naturelessness.

original: kun rdzob tu ni m'a ma k'i'i gzugs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni m'a ma k'i'i gzugs so //
translated: In the conventional, it is the form of Mamaki.🔽The pledge is non-abiding nirvana, which is of one taste with existence and peace.

original: dam tshig ni srid pa dang zhi ba mnyam pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: dam tshig ni srid pa dang zhi ba mnyam pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Because it is said:

original: shes pas srid la mi gnas shing ;
analyzed: shes pas srid la mi gnas shing ;
translated: By knowledge one does not abide in existence,

original: / snying rjes zhi la mi gnas te //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / snying rjes zhi la mi gnas te //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and by compassion one does not abide in peace.

original: gang la de nyid rdo rje yin pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang la de nyid rdo rje yin pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: One who has that vajra reality is so-called.

original: de la snyoms par zhugs nas so //
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs nas so //
translated: Having entered into union with her,🔽the supreme queen of the vajra-holder,

original: rdo rje 'dzin gyi btsun mo'i mchog 'di zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin gyi btsun mo'i mchog 'di zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'o //
translated: this is unsurpassed.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la rigs kyi bye brag gi sgo nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la rigs kyi bye brag gi sgo nas shes par bya'o //
translated: And so it is to be understood in all cases, according to the distinctions of the families.

original: rdo rje bsrung ba'i sbyor ba las //
analyzed: rdo rje bsrung ba'i sbyor ba las //
translated: From the union of vajra protection,

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi rnal 'byor gyis ro langs la sogs pas sgrub pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi rnal 'byor gyis ro langs la sogs pas sgrub pa rnams la'o //
translated: this is for those who practice with zombies and so forth, by means of one's own yoga.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas rang gi mgo la dve sha ra ti zhes bya ba'i snying po las byung ba'i rdo rje kha gyen du bltas shing zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa bsams te /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas rang gi mgo la dve sha ra ti zhes bya ba'i snying po las byung ba'i rdo rje kha gyen du bltas shing zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa bsams te /
translated: Endowed with one's own deity yoga just as it is, one imagines a vajra in one's own head, facing upward, arisen from the essence veśaraṭi, and situated on a moon disk.

original: de'i lte ba'i nang na gnas pa'i m'a ma k'i bsams la /
analyzed: de'i lte ba'i nang na gnas pa'i m'a ma k'i bsams la /
translated: One imagines Māmakī situated in its center.

original: ye shes kyi lha mo'i thugs ka'i padma'i steng gi zla ba la gnas pa'i phreng ba'i sngags las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse gsum pa rnams kyis bdag nyid rkang pa'i mthil gyi bar du rdo rje'i go bgos par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi lha mo'i thugs ka'i padma'i steng gi zla ba la gnas pa'i phreng ba'i sngags las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse gsum pa rnams kyis bdag nyid rkang pa'i mthil gyi bar du rdo rje'i go bgos par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize that one is armored with a vajra from the tip of the hair to the soles of the feet, by means of three-pointed vajras arising from the mantra string located on the moon in the lotus at the heart of the Goddess of Awareness.

original: de ltar na mi phyed pa'i bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na mi phyed pa'i bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, one becomes invulnerable.

original: las rnams rtag tu rab sgrub pa //
analyzed: las rnams rtag tu rab sgrub pa //
translated: Always accomplishing all activities

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas spyan bzhin du zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rab tu bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas spyan bzhin du zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rab tu bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: means that one will accomplish all activities such as pacifying, just like Buddhalocanā.

original: rdo rje chen po ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: rdo rje chen po ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: The Great Vajra is Śrī Vajrasattva.

original: de'i @240b 'jigs pas myos par gyur pa rnams la yang 'di ni rtag tu stobs bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i @240b 'jigs pas myos par gyur pa rnams la yang 'di ni rtag tu stobs bskyed pa yin no //
translated: For those who are frightened by him, this is always an increase in strength.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na gdon la sogs pa thams cad kyi 'jigs pas 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i sems can la bshad ma thag pa'i cho ga'i sgo nas 'di nyid kyis bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na gdon la sogs pa thams cad kyi 'jigs pas 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i sems can la bshad ma thag pa'i cho ga'i sgo nas 'di nyid kyis bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, for those sentient beings who are frightened by all the fears of demons and so forth, one should protect them by this very [mantra] through the procedure that has just been explained.

original: mngon spyod bya ba'i sems can kha sbyar phye bar gyur cing srung ba dang bral ba la yang gal te rnal 'byor ba 'dis 'di'i sgo nas bsrung bar byas nas de yang mi phyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon spyod bya ba'i sems can kha sbyar phye bar gyur cing srung ba dang bral ba la yang gal te rnal 'byor ba 'dis 'di'i sgo nas bsrung bar byas nas de yang mi phyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even for those sentient beings who are to be acted upon wrathfully, who are separated from protection by having their mouths opened, if they are protected by this yogin through this [mantra], they will not be split apart.

original: 'dod chags chen po ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Great passion is Amitābha.

original: de'i dam tshig ni gos dkar mo ste /
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni gos dkar mo ste /
translated: His pledge is Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: gang la de gzigs shed ye shes kyi spyan gyis yul du bya ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la de gzigs shed ye shes kyi spyan gyis yul du bya ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: One who is seen by her, who is made an object by the eye of gnosis, is so-called.

original: chos te mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams rgyas shing 'phel bar byed pas na chos rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: chos te mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams rgyas shing 'phel bar byed pas na chos rgyas pa'o //
translated: Dharma is the fearlessnesses and so forth. Since it causes them to expand and increase, it is the expansion of Dharma.

original: stobs mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni nad la sogs pa rnams kyis nyams pa rgyas par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: stobs mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni nad la sogs pa rnams kyis nyams pa rgyas par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The performance of power is the performance of the increase of the decrease due to disease, etc.

original: mdzod chen po ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin gyi dkon mchog dpal te de dang yang dag par ldan pas na mdzod chen po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mdzod chen po ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin gyi dkon mchog dpal te de dang yang dag par ldan pas na mdzod chen po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The great treasure is Ratnasambhava, whose nature is the sky-treasury meditative stabilization, and he is possessed of that, thus he is endowed with the great treasure.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: ji lta ba bzhin du 'od dpag tu med pa dang bcas pa'i gos dkar mo sku mdog ser po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas snga ma bzhin du dbang bskur ba rnams kyi sgo nas stobs zad pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang dbul po'i nor 'phel bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du 'od dpag tu med pa dang bcas pa'i gos dkar mo sku mdog ser po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas snga ma bzhin du dbang bskur ba rnams kyi sgo nas stobs zad pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang dbul po'i nor 'phel bar bya'o //
translated: Endowed with the yoga of yellow-colored Pāṇḍaravāsinī together with Amitābha just as before, one should increase the power of the weak and increase the wealth of the poor by means of the empowerments.

original: bzlas pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i bsgom pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis sngags brjod pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bzlas pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i bsgom pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis sngags brjod pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By mere recitation means by the mere recitation of the mantra preceded by the previously explained meditation.

original: 'gro ba ma lus pa'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir kun nas yang dag par 'byung bas na kun nas 'byung ba ste 'phags ma sgrol ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus pa'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir kun nas yang dag par 'byung bas na kun nas 'byung ba ste 'phags ma sgrol ma yin zhing /
translated: Since she is the source of the accomplishment of the activities of all migrating beings, she is the source, the noble Tara.

original: de'i sngags brjod pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa mi phyed pa ni ting nge 'dzin te de la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i sngags brjod pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa mi phyed pa ni ting nge 'dzin te de la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Her mantra recitation is the undivided, single-pointed mind, the samadhi, and so forth, as previously explained.

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te /
translated: The vajra buddhas are the tathagatas.

original: de rnams kyi sde ni tshogs yin pas /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sde ni tshogs yin pas /
translated: Since their assembly is their group,

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje bde chen no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje bde chen no //
translated: the vajra buddhas are the great bliss.

original: sems can khams ni ma lus pa //
analyzed: sems can khams ni ma lus pa //
translated: The entire realm of sentient beings

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du 'od dpag tu med pa dang yang dag par ldan zhing de'i mdog can gyi 'phags ma sgrol ma gdan dang 'od dang rgyan dmar po dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ji lta ba bzhin du @241a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du 'od dpag tu med pa dang yang dag par ldan zhing de'i mdog can gyi 'phags ma sgrol ma gdan dang 'od dang rgyan dmar po dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ji lta ba bzhin du @241a * //
translated: is as follows: One should visualize the noble Tara, endowed with Amitabha, the same color as him, with a red seat, light, and ornaments, just as the yogi or yogini is.

original: byas la / ye shes kyi rig ma'i thugs kar padma'i steng gi zla ba la phreng ba'i sngags kha dog dmar po mgo gyen du bltas pa rnam par bkod de /
analyzed: byas la / ye shes kyi rig ma'i thugs kar padma'i steng gi zla ba la phreng ba'i sngags kha dog dmar po mgo gyen du bltas pa rnam par bkod de /
translated: Having done that, one should arrange the rosary mantra in the heart of the gnosis knowledge consort, on a moon on a lotus, red in color, with the head facing upward.

original: aom las byung ba'i yi ge a'a: yis bskyed pa'i mnga' kha 'ug gi dngos po yi ge h'um las byung ba'i autpala dmar po kha ma bye ba'i mde'u dang ldan pa rang gi sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rna rtsa'i bar du bkang bas bsgrub bya skyes pa'i
analyzed: aom las byung ba'i yi ge a'a: yis bskyed pa'i mnga' kha 'ug gi dngos po yi ge h'um las byung ba'i autpala dmar po kha ma bye ba'i mde'u dang ldan pa rang gi sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rna rtsa'i bar du bkang bas bsgrub bya skyes pa'i
translated: One should bless the arrow generated from the syllable AḤ arisen from OṀ, the nature of a peacock feather, with one’s own mantra, the tip of which is an unopened red utpala flower arisen from the syllable HŪṀ, and which is inserted into one’s ear.

original: snying dang lkog ma dmar po dang bud med kyi padma phug la /
analyzed: snying dang lkog ma dmar po dang bud med kyi padma phug la /
translated: The heart and throat of a male are red, and the interior of the lotus of a female is red.

original: rang gi snying ga las phreng ba'i sngags rdo rje nas byung ba de'i khar bcug ste /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga las phreng ba'i sngags rdo rje nas byung ba de'i khar bcug ste /
translated: The rosary mantra arisen from one’s heart is inserted into the mouth of the person to be summoned.

original: de'i sems zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dmar po'i rnam pa can bkug nas log ste /
analyzed: de'i sems zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dmar po'i rnam pa can bkug nas log ste /
translated: One should summon the mind of the person to be summoned in the aspect of a red moon disk, and it returns.

original: ye shes kyi lha mo'i padma'i lam nas snying gar bcug la bzlas pa bya zhing /
analyzed: ye shes kyi lha mo'i padma'i lam nas snying gar bcug la bzlas pa bya zhing /
translated: Having inserted it into the heart through the path of the lotus of the gnosis goddess, one should perform the recitation.

original: bsgrub bya yang snying 'phrog shing rtsa ba nas bcad pa'i ljon shing bzhin du rkang pa'i drung du 'gyel bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya yang snying 'phrog shing rtsa ba nas bcad pa'i ljon shing bzhin du rkang pa'i drung du 'gyel bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The object of attainment is to be seen as having fallen at one's feet like a tree whose root has been cut.

original: de ltar na bran bzhin du thams cad byed par dbang du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bran bzhin du thams cad byed par dbang du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that all will be brought under one's control, like a servant.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The Tathagata of Body, Speech, and Mind Vajras is glorious Vajrasattva.

original: gshin rje gshed gang la dri ma med pa ste /
analyzed: gshin rje gshed gang la dri ma med pa ste /
translated: Yama is the one who is stainless,

original: rtog pa'i skyon dri ma thams cad dang bral zhing /
analyzed: rtog pa'i skyon dri ma thams cad dang bral zhing /
translated: free from all the faults of conceptualization,

original: thugs rdo rje chen po las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi sprin spro bar bya ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: thugs rdo rje chen po las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi sprin spro bar bya ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba ste /
translated: and who has the cloud of light rays that emanate from the great mind vajra.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mi phyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mi phyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The samadhi that has that as its object is so called because it is indivisible.

original: sangs rgyas grags pa chen po kun //
analyzed: sangs rgyas grags pa chen po kun //
translated: All the Buddhas of great fame

original: zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor ba rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor ba rnams so //
translated: This is the mandala of the family of delusion.

original: 'jigs shing kun du skrag gyur nas //
analyzed: 'jigs shing kun du skrag gyur nas //
translated: Terrified and frightened,

original: zhes bya ba ni rigs nges pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams dang rjes su mthun par ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rigs nges pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams dang rjes su mthun par ston pa'o //
translated: this shows that the Teacher is in accord with the beings of fixed family, etc.

original: rdo rje'i sems ni rjes su dran //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sems ni rjes su dran //
translated: Recollecting the vajra mind,

original: zhes bya bas ni rdo rje 'chang chen po rjes su dran pas 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni rdo rje 'chang chen po rjes su dran pas 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang bstan to //
translated: this shows that by recollecting Great Vajradhara, one becomes free from all fear.🔽The skull, etc.,

original: thod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gong bu dgug par brtsams pa gsungs so //
analyzed: thod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gong bu dgug par brtsams pa gsungs so //
translated: shows the beginning of the summoning of the nine heaps.

original: 'di skad du ji skad bshad pa'i sku'i dkyil 'khor du rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes thogs la 'phags pa gshin rje gshed dbyung ba dang / gzhug par gyur par byas nas /
analyzed: 'di skad du ji skad bshad pa'i sku'i dkyil 'khor du rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes thogs la 'phags pa gshin rje gshed dbyung ba dang / gzhug par gyur par byas nas /
translated: This is what is meant: One who is endowed with the yoga of Great Vajradhara in the mandala of body as explained, after the first union samadhi, should summon and enter the noble Yamantaka.

original: bdag nyid 'phags pa @241b gshin rje gshed zhal bzhi pa phyag drug pa zhabs bzhi pa /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'phags pa @241b gshin rje gshed zhal bzhi pa phyag drug pa zhabs bzhi pa /
translated: One should visualize oneself as Noble Yamantaka with four faces, six arms, and four feet.

original: phyag na ral gri dang gtun shing dang dgra sta dang zhags pa bsnams pa lhag ma bshad zin pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan par dmigs la /
analyzed: phyag na ral gri dang gtun shing dang dgra sta dang zhags pa bsnams pa lhag ma bshad zin pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan par dmigs la /
translated: In the hands he holds a sword, a pestle, an axe, and a noose. The rest of the characteristics are as previously explained.

original: bzlas pa las bshad pa'i cho ga bzhin du bzlas pa mang du bya'o //
analyzed: bzlas pa las bshad pa'i cho ga bzhin du bzlas pa mang du bya'o //
translated: One should do many recitations according to the ritual explained in the recitation section.

original: de nas lha rnams kyis rjes su gnang bar gyur cing bzlas pa 'bum byas pas bud med kyi thod pa bzang po ma chag pa blangs te /
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyis rjes su gnang bar gyur cing bzlas pa 'bum byas pas bud med kyi thod pa bzang po ma chag pa blangs te /
translated: Then, having received permission from the deities, one should take an excellent skull of a woman that is not broken.🔽On the outside of that, in the center of an eight-petaled great lotus, one should write the mantra marked at the heart of Noble Buddhalocana, who has all the supreme aspects, and so on.

original: de'i phyi rol du padma chen po 'dab ma brgyad pa'i lte ba la rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'phags ma sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i thugs kar sngags kyis mtshan pa bris la phyi rol du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du padma chen po 'dab ma brgyad pa'i lte ba la rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'phags ma sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i thugs kar sngags kyis mtshan pa bris la phyi rol du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas
translated: On the outside, on a sun maṇḍala, one should write the name of the person for whom one is performing the rite.

original: pa'i aom las byung ba'i 'khor lo lcags kyus mtshan pa'i g-yas brkyang ba'i rkang pa g-yon pa'i mthil gyis mnan te /
analyzed: pa'i aom las byung ba'i 'khor lo lcags kyus mtshan pa'i g-yas brkyang ba'i rkang pa g-yon pa'i mthil gyis mnan te /
translated: From the oṃ in the heart, a wheel marked with an iron hook arises.🔽

original: lcags kyu des snying gar phug la bkug par bsam zhing bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas pa'i sngags bsgrag pa dang bcas pas lan gsum brjod na gdon mi za bar 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lcags kyu des snying gar phug la bkug par bsam zhing bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas pa'i sngags bsgrag pa dang bcas pas lan gsum brjod na gdon mi za bar 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The mantra is recited three times, together with the words of entreaty, and the hook pierces the heart of the one to be summoned, who is then imagined to arrive.

original: gnod sbyin mo la sogs pa rnams kyang de bzhin du dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo la sogs pa rnams kyang de bzhin du dgug par bya'o //
translated: The mantra is taught to summon yakṣiṇīs and so forth in the same way.

original: skyes bu'i thod par g-yon brkyang pa'i rkang pas bsgrub bya mnan te skyes bu dgug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i thod par g-yon brkyang pa'i rkang pas bsgrub bya mnan te skyes bu dgug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
translated: The difference is that the one to be summoned is placed under one’s foot in a leftward extended position in a human skull.

original: yang na ka zhes bya ba bde ba yin zhing de srung bar byed cing 'phel bar byed pas na ka p'a la ste thod pa ni bu mo bzhon nu ma'i lus so //
analyzed: yang na ka zhes bya ba bde ba yin zhing de srung bar byed cing 'phel bar byed pas na ka p'a la ste thod pa ni bu mo bzhon nu ma'i lus so //
translated: Or else, ka means bliss, and that which protects and increases it is a kapāla, a skull, which is the body of a young girl.

original: ma chag pa zhes bya ba ni skye gnas ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: ma chag pa zhes bya ba ni skye gnas ma nyams pa'o //
translated: “Not broken” means not damaged.

original: mdzes zhes bya ba ni gzugs mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: mdzes zhes bya ba ni gzugs mdzes pa'o //
translated: Beautiful is a beautiful form.

original: 'dod pa tshim par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yid du 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa tshim par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yid du 'ong ba ste /
translated: It is pleasing because it satisfies desire.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan khyad par can dang ldan pa mdun na gnas pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas spyan gyi gzugs su bskyed la /

analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: don yod par grub pa'o //

analyzed: cho ga'i tshul bzhin bskul ba yis //

original: gdug pa thams cad gsod par 'gyur //
analyzed: gdug pa thams cad gsod par 'gyur //
translated: all the wicked will be killed.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du 'phags pa dbyig pa sngon po can gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas sha chen dang dur khrod kyi sol ba dang / bal mi ka'i sa dang spun pa dang bsgrub bya'i p'a da pam su rnams kyis gzugs brnyan byas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du 'phags pa dbyig pa sngon po can gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas sha chen dang dur khrod kyi sol ba dang / bal mi ka'i sa dang spun pa dang bsgrub bya'i p'a da pam su rnams kyis gzugs brnyan byas te /
translated: As it is, one who is endowed with the yoga of the noble Nīlāṣṭa should make an effigy with human flesh, charnel ground ash, and mustard seed, and with the pāda of the victim.

original: dur khrod kyi gos la dug dang khrag dang rams rnams kyis sna tshogs rdo rje la me'i dkyil 'khor dang / de'i dbus su bsgrub bya'i ming sngags dang rnam par spel ba bris la /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi gos la dug dang khrag dang rams rnams kyis sna tshogs rdo rje la me'i dkyil 'khor dang / de'i dbus su bsgrub bya'i ming sngags dang rnam par spel ba bris la /
translated: On a cloth from a charnel ground, with poison, blood, and lac, one should draw a vajra cross on a fire maṇḍala, and in the center of that, one should write the name and mantra of the victim.

original: de'i snying gar bcug ste /
analyzed: de'i snying gar bcug ste /
translated: One should place that in the heart.

original: phyi rol du thod pa gnyis kyi nang du bcug la /
analyzed: phyi rol du thod pa gnyis kyi nang du bcug la /
translated: Externally, place the two skulls.

original: de gsad pa'i phyir shin tu khro zhing gtum par gyur pas rkang pa g-yon pas kun du mnan te /
analyzed: de gsad pa'i phyir shin tu khro zhing gtum par gyur pas rkang pa g-yon pas kun du mnan te /
translated: In order to kill him, having become very angry and fierce, trample him with the left foot.

original: nyi ma phyed dang mtshan phyed kyi dus su rdo ba dang rus pa dang nim pa'i lo ma rnams kyis sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad byas na /
analyzed: nyi ma phyed dang mtshan phyed kyi dus su rdo ba dang rus pa dang nim pa'i lo ma rnams kyis sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad byas na /
translated: At the time of midday and midnight, having made a burnt offering of stones, bones, and neem leaves, one should do one hundred and eight burnt offerings.

original: zhag bdun na 'chi bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun na 'chi bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In seven days, he will die.

original: de lta na yang ma grub na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ma grub na /
translated: If he is not accomplished even in that way,

original: dur khrod du song ste mtshan phyed kyi dus su ro bsregs kyi thal bas me thab grub gsum byas la /
analyzed: dur khrod du song ste mtshan phyed kyi dus su ro bsregs kyi thal bas me thab grub gsum byas la /
translated: having gone to a charnel ground, at midnight, one should make a triangular hearth with the ash of a cremation fire.

original: nim pa'i shing nyid kyi sbar te de'i dbus su spyan drang ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyis khro bo'i rgyal po mche ba gtsigs shing 'jigs su rung ba zhal 'jigs su rung bar byas pa rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: nim pa'i shing nyid kyi sbar te de'i dbus su spyan drang ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyis khro bo'i rgyal po mche ba gtsigs shing 'jigs su rung ba zhal 'jigs su rung bar byas pa rnam par bsams la /
translated: Having ignited it with neem wood, having invited him there, one should imagine the King of Wrathful Ones, his fangs bared, terrifying, his face terrifying.

original: mtshon rnon pos pra ti kri ta rkang pa g-yon pa'i aa na mi ka nas brtsams te gtubs nas shin tu khro ba'i dbang du gyur pas che ge mo m'a ra ya ti zhes bya ba'i bskul ba dang bcas pa'i sngags khro bo'i tshig gis brjod cing tad
analyzed: mtshon rnon pos pra ti kri ta rkang pa g-yon pa'i aa na mi ka nas brtsams te gtubs nas shin tu khro ba'i dbang du gyur pas che ge mo m'a ra ya ti zhes bya ba'i bskul ba dang bcas pa'i sngags khro bo'i tshig gis brjod cing tad
translated: and the exclamation of urging, “haṭha!”

original: wad khro bo yang sbyin sreg byas na de nyid kyi mtshan mo la gdon mi za bar 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: wad khro bo yang sbyin sreg byas na de nyid kyi mtshan mo la gdon mi za bar 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and perform the homa of the wrathful one. Then, on that very night, he will certainly die.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: kun nas ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin can gyi mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin can gyi mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: Akṣobhya is all-around, having the nature of the gnosis of the dharmadhātu without beginning or end,

original: thams cad la khyab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la khyab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he pervades everything.

original: de la sa byung ba'i sprin gyi dpal ni sprin gyi char phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das stobs po che ste /
analyzed: de la sa byung ba'i sprin gyi dpal ni sprin gyi char phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das stobs po che ste /
translated: There, the cloud of glory that arises from the earth is the glorious cloud endowed with the perfection of rain, and so is the Bhagavān Mahābala.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The meditative stabilization that has that as its object is called that.

original: bzlas pa tsam gyi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: bzlas pa tsam gyi sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the mere application of repetition,

original: las rnams thams cad @244a * //
analyzed: las rnams thams cad @244a * //
translated: all the rites

original: sgrub par byed //🔽ces bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i cho ga bzhin du bzlas pa 'bum byas shing /
analyzed: sgrub par byed // ces bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i cho ga bzhin du bzlas pa 'bum byas shing /
translated: are accomplished.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i sbyor bas zhi ba la sogs pa'i lha thams cad kyi las rnams bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i sbyor bas zhi ba la sogs pa'i lha thams cad kyi las rnams bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, having done a hundred thousand repetitions according to the previously explained ritual, one should accomplish all the rites of all the deities such as the pacifying, etc., by the application as explained.

original: chu yi dkyil 'khor 'bebs par byed //
analyzed: chu yi dkyil 'khor 'bebs par byed //
translated: One causes the water mandala to descend.

original: ces bya bas ni 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ces bya bas ni 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is taught as follows.

original: de kho na bzhin du rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis yi ge phat kyis byung ba'i 'phags pa stobs po cher bdag nyid bsams la /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis yi ge phat kyis byung ba'i 'phags pa stobs po cher bdag nyid bsams la /
translated: Just as before, having gone for refuge and generated the mind of enlightenment, one should transform oneself into Noble Mahābala arisen from the syllable phaṭ, preceded by the transformation of Great Vajradhara.

original: 'bum bzlas nas kham phor so ma btang ba la rams kyi khu bas ral gri rtsibs brgyad pa'i 'khor lo dang / de'i steng du padma 'dab brgyad pa la mdung can ma'i sngags dang rnam par spel ba'i klu thams cad kyi snying po bris te /
analyzed: 'bum bzlas nas kham phor so ma btang ba la rams kyi khu bas ral gri rtsibs brgyad pa'i 'khor lo dang / de'i steng du padma 'dab brgyad pa la mdung can ma'i sngags dang rnam par spel ba'i klu thams cad kyi snying po bris te /
translated: Having recited one hundred thousand times, on a new earthen pot, with the liquid of turmeric, draw an eight-spoked wheel with a sword and on top of that an eight-petaled lotus with the mantra of Kṣetrapāla and the essence of all nāgas.

original: kham por gzhan dang kha sbyar la skud pa sngon pos kun nas dkris te /
analyzed: kham por gzhan dang kha sbyar la skud pa sngon pos kun nas dkris te /
translated: Having joined it with another pot, wrap it completely with blue thread.

original: mdung can ma dang klu rnams spyan drangs la yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: mdung can ma dang klu rnams spyan drangs la yang dag par mchod de /
translated: Having invited Kṣetrapāla and the nāgas, make offerings.

original: klu gnas pa'i chu mig la sogs par klu thams cad kun du skul bar byed pa'i kham phor kha sbyar te bzhag la /
analyzed: klu gnas pa'i chu mig la sogs par klu thams cad kun du skul bar byed pa'i kham phor kha sbyar te bzhag la /
translated: Having placed the pot that summons all nāgas in a place such as a spring where nāgas dwell,

original: sa phyogs dben pa gzhan du me'i dkyil 'khor la rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang de'i steng du chu dang / de'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris te /
analyzed: sa phyogs dben pa gzhan du me'i dkyil 'khor la rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang de'i steng du chu dang / de'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris te /
translated: in another isolated place, draw a fire maṇḍala, a wind maṇḍala, and on top of that, water, and in the center of that, an eight-petaled lotus.

original: de'i lte bar rlung lha mdog dkar po sprul mgo bdun gyi gdengs ka dang ldan pa skyes bu'i gdong can lag na sbrul gyi zhags pa thogs pa bri zhing shar gyi 'dab ma la mtha' yas autpala ljang gu'i mdog can dang / lhor nor rgyas kyi bu dkar po dang /
analyzed: de'i lte bar rlung lha mdog dkar po sprul mgo bdun gyi gdengs ka dang ldan pa skyes bu'i gdong can lag na sbrul gyi zhags pa thogs pa bri zhing shar gyi 'dab ma la mtha' yas autpala ljang gu'i mdog can dang / lhor nor rgyas kyi bu dkar po dang /
translated: In its center, draw the wind god, white in color, with the hood of seven snake heads, the face of a human being, and holding a snake noose in his hand.🔽On the eastern petal, draw Ananta, green in color and the hue of an utpala flower; in the south, white Vāsuki;

original: nub tu 'jog po dmar po dang / byang du stobs rgyu nag po dang / me dang bden bral gyi mtshams dag tu padma dang padma chen po dkar po dang / rlung gi mtshams su dung skyong ser po dang / dbang ldan gyi mtshams su rigs ldan sna tshogs kyi mdog can de de lta bu'i klu'i dkyil 'khor bris la /
analyzed: nub tu 'jog po dmar po dang / byang du stobs rgyu nag po dang / me dang bden bral gyi mtshams dag tu padma dang padma chen po dkar po dang / rlung gi mtshams su dung skyong ser po dang / dbang ldan gyi mtshams su rigs ldan sna tshogs kyi mdog can de de lta bu'i klu'i dkyil 'khor bris la /
translated: in the west, red Padma; in the north, black Karkota; in the southeast and southwest, white Padma and Mahāpadma; in the northeast and northwest, yellow Śaṅkhapāla and multicolored Kulika.

original: yi ge nam las klu thams cad bsams te /
analyzed: yi ge nam las klu thams cad bsams te /
translated: Having drawn the maṇḍala of the nāgas in that way, one should imagine all the nāgas from the syllable nma.

original: de nas kha dog sngon po dang ldan pa'i bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyis 'o ma dang bu ram la sogs klu dang rjes su mthun pa'i lha bshos byin la /
analyzed: de nas kha dog sngon po dang ldan pa'i bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyis 'o ma dang bu ram la sogs klu dang rjes su mthun pa'i lha bshos byin la /
translated: Then, with a pot that has a blue color and so forth, give milk, molasses, and so forth, and the sacrificial cakes that are in accordance with the nāgas.

original: yi ge dza: dang rnam par spel ba'i yi ge nam gyis bkug ste /
analyzed: yi ge dza: dang rnam par spel ba'i yi ge nam gyis bkug ste /
translated: Summon with the syllable nmaḥ, which is combined with the syllable jraḥ.

original: rang rang gi gnas rnams su bcug la mchod pa byas te /
analyzed: rang rang gi gnas rnams su bcug la mchod pa byas te /
translated: Having placed them in their respective places, make offerings.

original: 'di skad du bdag la brtse ba dang bcom ldan 'das kyi bkas klu chen po khyed @244b rnams kyis char phob cig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du bdag la brtse ba dang bcom ldan 'das kyi bkas klu chen po khyed @244b rnams kyis char phob cig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Say this: “Out of love for me, and by the word of the Bhagavat, you great nāgas should send down rain.”

original: de nas klu de rnams char gyi rgyun rab tu 'bebs par bsam zhing bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: de nas klu de rnams char gyi rgyun rab tu 'bebs par bsam zhing bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: Then, thinking that those nāgas are sending down a stream of rain, do the recitation.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi bkas klu de rnams kyis char 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi bkas klu de rnams kyis char 'bebs par byed do //
translated: Then, by the word of the Bhagavat, those nāgas will send down rain.

original: gal te de ltar byas kyang char mi 'bebs na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar byas kyang char mi 'bebs na /
translated: If, even though you do it that way, it does not rain,

original: de'i tshe me thab zlum po la de kho na bzhin du dkyil 'khor bris nas spyan drang ba sngon du 'gro bas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sbyin sreg gi cho ga bzhin du klu thams cad kyi lce'i dbus su yi ge nam bsams la /
analyzed: de'i tshe me thab zlum po la de kho na bzhin du dkyil 'khor bris nas spyan drang ba sngon du 'gro bas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sbyin sreg gi cho ga bzhin du klu thams cad kyi lce'i dbus su yi ge nam bsams la /
translated: At that time, having drawn the maṇḍala just as before on a round hearth, having previously invited [the deity], one should offer three ladlefuls of oblations with molasses, milk, and ghee, having previously offered a libation, and so on, according to the rite of burnt offerings to be explained.

original: mchod yon la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bu ram dang 'o ma dang mar rnams kyis dgang blugs gsum phul te /
analyzed: mchod yon la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bu ram dang 'o ma dang mar rnams kyis dgang blugs gsum phul te /
translated: Having visualized the syllable nam in the center of the tongue of all nāgas,

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bu ram dang 'o ma dang mar la sogs pa sbyin sreg byas na dga' bar gyur nas gdon mi za bar char gyi rgyun 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bu ram dang 'o ma dang mar la sogs pa sbyin sreg byas na dga' bar gyur nas gdon mi za bar char gyi rgyun 'bebs par byed do //
translated: if one performs a burnt offering of molasses, milk, ghee, and so on, as desired, they will be pleased and will certainly cause a rain shower.

original: gal te de lta na yang char mi 'bebs pa de'i tshe mngon spyod bya ste /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang char mi 'bebs pa de'i tshe mngon spyod bya ste /
translated: If even then it does not rain, at that time one should perform the rite of assault.

original: grog mkhar dang chu bo'i 'gram gnyis kyis bshang ba dang gci ba dang sbrus pas klu'i gzugs brnyan byas nas dur khrod kyi gos la dug dang khrag dang ske tshe dang tsha dang nyungs mar tsha bas ral gri'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa bris te /
analyzed: grog mkhar dang chu bo'i 'gram gnyis kyis bshang ba dang gci ba dang sbrus pas klu'i gzugs brnyan byas nas dur khrod kyi gos la dug dang khrag dang ske tshe dang tsha dang nyungs mar tsha bas ral gri'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa bris te /
translated: On the banks of an anthill and a river, make an image of a nāga with feces, urine, and clay. Draw an eight-spoked wheel of a sword on a piece of cloth from a charnel ground with poison, blood, black mustard seed, and hot mustard oil.

original: de'i steng du padma 'dab ma brgyad pa dang / 'dab ma brgyad la klu brgyad kyi khyad par gyi snying po rnams sam yi ge nam re re sngags dang rnam par spel ba dang / lte ba la yi ge bam de bzhin du bris la /
analyzed: de'i steng du padma 'dab ma brgyad pa dang / 'dab ma brgyad la klu brgyad kyi khyad par gyi snying po rnams sam yi ge nam re re sngags dang rnam par spel ba dang / lte ba la yi ge bam de bzhin du bris la /
translated: On top of that, draw an eight-petaled lotus, and on the eight petals, the distinctive essences of the eight nāgas, or the syllables nam, each multiplied by the mantra, and in the center, the syllable bham.

original: spyan drangs he de snying gar bcug la ske tshe la sogs pa tsha ba sreg rdzas rnams kyis rab tu byugs te /
analyzed: spyan drangs he de snying gar bcug la ske tshe la sogs pa tsha ba sreg rdzas rnams kyis rab tu byugs te /
translated: Having invoked the nāgas, place them in the heart, and smear them with hot substances such as black mustard seed.

original: sngags brjod cing me la gdungs na /
analyzed: sngags brjod cing me la gdungs na /
translated: Recite the mantra and heat them in the fire.

original: gdon mi za bar char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: Without doubt, it will rain.

original: gal te de ltar byas na yang klu rnams char mi 'bebs na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar byas na yang klu rnams char mi 'bebs na /
translated: If it still does not rain even though you do this,

original: de'i tshe de kho na bzhin du sa la klu'i dkyil 'khor bris la gos sngon po'am dmar pos stod g-yogs dang cod pan byas pa'am /
analyzed: de'i tshe de kho na bzhin du sa la klu'i dkyil 'khor bris la gos sngon po'am dmar pos stod g-yogs dang cod pan byas pa'am /
translated: At that time, having drawn the maṇḍala of the nāgas just as before, one should cover one’s upper body with a blue or red cloth, or be naked.

original: gcer bus dkyil 'khor de na gnas pa'i klu rnams nyi ma la gnas pa'i rdo rje 'bar bas mtshan pa'i rkang pa g-yon pas gan rkyal du mnan te /
analyzed: gcer bus dkyil 'khor de na gnas pa'i klu rnams nyi ma la gnas pa'i rdo rje 'bar bas mtshan pa'i rkang pa g-yon pas gan rkyal du mnan te /
translated: One should visualize the nāgas in the maṇḍala lying on their backs, pressed down by one’s left foot marked with a blazing vajra in the sun,

original: steng du bsgrags pa'i phat kyi sgras nam mkha' kun du khyab par byas nas shin tu 'jigs par gyur cing khrag skyugs pa'i rgyun rnams kyis chu'i rgya mtsho byed par blta zhing sngags bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: steng du bsgrags pa'i phat kyi sgras nam mkha' kun du khyab par byas nas shin tu 'jigs par gyur cing khrag skyugs pa'i rgyun rnams kyis chu'i rgya mtsho byed par blta zhing sngags bzlas par bya ste /
translated: and with the sound of the Phat! resounding above, filling the whole sky, becoming very frightened and vomiting streams of blood, making an ocean of water, and one should recite the mantra.

original: aom h'um nam h'um nam h'um /
analyzed: aom h'um nam h'um nam h'um /
translated: Oṃ hūṃ naṃ hūṃ naṃ hūṃ.

analyzed: phat nam phat nam phat /
translated: Phaṭ naṃ phaṭ naṃ phaṭ.

translated: Ugraśātulapanī.

analyzed: h'um nam h'um nam h'um /
translated: Hūṃ naṃ hūṃ naṃ hūṃ.

analyzed: @245a * // m'a ra ya sarba n'a g'a na /
translated: Māra ya sarvanāgān.

original: phat nam phat nam phat /
analyzed: phat nam phat nam phat /
translated: Phaṭ naṃ phaṭ naṃ phaṭ.

translated: Oṃ jyotini raṇā.

translated: Hana nāga.

analyzed: wa ra sh'a pa ya sh'i ghr'am bha ga w'ana /
translated: Varṣāpaya śīghraṃ bhagavān.

original: h'um nam h'um nam h'um /
analyzed: h'um nam h'um nam h'um /
translated: Hūṃ naṃ hūṃ naṃ hūṃ.

original: aom aom aom /

translated: Oṃ oṃ oṃ.

original: phat phat phat nam phat /

translated: Phaṭ phaṭ phaṭ naṃ phaṭ.

translated: Oṃ mahābalāya svāhā.
