analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub bya 'od dpag tu med pa ni sku mdog dmar po /
translated: However, the object of attainment, Amitābha, is red-colored.

original: de bzhin bsgrub bya gzhan rnams kyang gnyug ma'i sku mdog dang ldan zhing 'jigs pas myos pa dang dngos grub ster ba la mngon du phyogs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin bsgrub bya gzhan rnams kyang gnyug ma'i sku mdog dang ldan zhing 'jigs pas myos pa dang dngos grub ster ba la mngon du phyogs par shes par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the other objects of attainment should be known to have their natural colors, to be terrified, and to be inclined to grant powers.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: thugs ni mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: thugs ni mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: Mind is Akshobhya.

original: de'i rnam par 'phrul pa rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par 'phrul pa rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The emanation of that is the vajra samadhi, and that is also called the vajra samadhi.

original: rtse mo lnga par zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas rang gi gsang ba'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: rtse mo lnga par zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas rang gi gsang ba'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'bar ba'o //
translated: The five-pointed vajra is the blazing five-pointed vajra of one's own secret vajra, endowed with the yoga of Akshobhya.

original: bcings pa ni 'phags ma m'a ma k'i'i padma nyid do //
analyzed: bcings pa ni 'phags ma m'a ma k'i'i padma nyid do //
translated: Binding is the lotus of the noble Mamaki.

original: de'i nang na gnas pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa'i bsgrub bya mi bskyod pa bzhugs pa'i rdo rjes mnan pa ni rdo rje thugs kyi tshul mnan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nang na gnas pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa'i bsgrub bya mi bskyod pa bzhugs pa'i rdo rjes mnan pa ni rdo rje thugs kyi tshul mnan pa'o //
translated: The one to be accomplished, Akshobhya, who resides in the mandala of the sun that is located in that, is pressed down by the vajra, and that is the method of pressing down the vajra mind.

original: sku dang gsung dang rdo rje'i tshul mnan pa yang de dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang rdo rje'i tshul mnan pa yang de dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: The method of pressing down the vajra body and speech is similar to that.

original: rdo rje phur bus nges par gdab //
analyzed: rdo rje phur bus nges par gdab //
translated: One should definitely drive in the vajra stake.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa thams cad ni /
translated: All of that, etc.,

original: rnam par snang mdzad bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad bzhin no //
translated: is like Vairochana.

original: phur 'debs sangs rgyas thams cad dang // byang chub sems dpa' grags chen te //
analyzed: phur 'debs sangs rgyas thams cad dang // byang chub sems dpa' grags chen te //
translated: The stake-driving of all the Buddhas and the great Bodhisattvas,

original: zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba las bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba las bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: is taught in the following passage from the Tantra which is to be explained:

original: rig ma dang bcas shing kun du sngo ba khro zhing 'bar ba'i lha dang phur bu bsgom pa dag gis ji skad bshad pa'i dkon mchog dpal la sogs pa bsgrub bya'i lha thams cad la phur bur gdab pa'i bsgrub pa shes par bya'o //🔽bshad ma thag pa'i yang dag pa'i cho ga dang ldan pa'i sngags kyi sgo nas mi phyed pa'i phur bu ste /
analyzed: rig ma dang bcas shing kun du sngo ba khro zhing 'bar ba'i lha dang phur bu bsgom pa dag gis ji skad bshad pa'i dkon mchog dpal la sogs pa bsgrub bya'i lha thams cad la phur bur gdab pa'i bsgrub pa shes par bya'o // bshad ma thag pa'i yang dag pa'i cho ga dang ldan pa'i sngags kyi sgo nas mi phyed pa'i phur bu ste /
translated: One should know the stake-driving accomplishment by means of the meditation on the Knowledge Goddess, the all-pervading, the wrathful, blazing deities and the stakes, with regard to all the accomplished deities such as Sri Heruka, etc., as taught.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The stake is the indivisible Sri Heruka, who is the mantra-gate endowed with the just explained perfect rite.

original: de nas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Then, the Buddhas, etc., have been explained.

original: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: Emaho is amazement.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la bstan par mi bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir na gsang ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la bstan par mi bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir na gsang ba'o //
translated: It is secret because it should not be taught to the Sravakas, etc.

original: 'dis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las spros pa'i tshogs kyi don ston cing khong du chud par byed pas na tshig @252a * //
analyzed: 'dis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las spros pa'i tshogs kyi don ston cing khong du chud par byed pas na tshig @252a * //
translated: This is the secret word, because it teaches and causes one to understand the meaning of the group of rites of pacification, etc., and it is a word.

original: yin zhing / 'di ni gsang ba yang yin la tshig kyang yin pas na gsang ba'i tshig ste de nyid mchog yin no //
analyzed: yin zhing / 'di ni gsang ba yang yin la tshig kyang yin pas na gsang ba'i tshig ste de nyid mchog yin no //
translated: And it is a secret and a word, and that is the supreme.

original: sku rdo rje phur bus gdab pa'i sgo nas de'i go 'phang thob par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir snying po kun btus pa'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje phur bus gdab pa'i sgo nas de'i go 'phang thob par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir snying po kun btus pa'o //
translated: It is the compendium of the essence, because it causes one to attain that state by means of the implantation of the dagger of the Vajra Body.

original: de bzhin du 'od dpag tu med pa dang mi bskyod pa dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'od dpag tu med pa dang mi bskyod pa dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should apply it to Amitābha and Akṣobhya.

original: chur 'debs sangs rgyas thams cad dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: chur 'debs sangs rgyas thams cad dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The insertion into the water of all the Buddhas, etc., has been explained.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams //
translated: The Vajras of Body, Speech, and Mind

original: zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sems can yul rnams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sems can yul rnams te /
translated: are the objects, i.e., the sentient beings who are the nature of body, etc.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ces bya ba de nyid kyis sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams bsdus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ces bya ba de nyid kyis sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams bsdus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The all buddhas are included in the vajra body, etc. because they are the very same.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
translated: The this is the one just explained.

original: bde ba chen po las byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de nyid las byung ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po las byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de nyid las byung ba'o //
translated: It is arisen from that because it arises from great bliss.

original: mi phyed pa'i sku la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sku gsung thugs ni mchog ster ba'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i sku la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sku gsung thugs ni mchog ster ba'o //
translated: The supreme bestowal of body, speech, and mind is the bestowal of the vajra body, etc. because it is the very same.

original: slu ba med pa'i gnas mdor bsdus pa 'thob par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sngags kyi de nyid bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: slu ba med pa'i gnas mdor bsdus pa 'thob par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sngags kyi de nyid bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is the collection of mantra reality because it causes the attainment of the summarized, nondeceptive stage.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs nyid rmad du byung ba ste ngo mtshar du byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs nyid rmad du byung ba ste ngo mtshar du byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the marvel of all tathāgatas' body, speech, and mind because it is the very same.

original: de rnams kyi sngags te lha rnams 'gugs pa ni rnal 'byor gyis 'dul pa'i sems can gyi rgyud de'i bdag nyid du bya ba dang / 'phags ma spyan la sogs pa dgug pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sngags te lha rnams 'gugs pa ni rnal 'byor gyis 'dul pa'i sems can gyi rgyud de'i bdag nyid du bya ba dang / 'phags ma spyan la sogs pa dgug pa'o //
translated: It is the summoning of the nine noble ones, such as Locana.

original: des rnam par 'phrul pa'i rnam par rol pa yin zhing /
analyzed: des rnam par 'phrul pa'i rnam par rol pa yin zhing /
translated: That is the manifestation of the play of the emanations.

original: de nyid kyis gsal zhing rgyal bas na sku dang gsung dang thugs rmad du byung ba'i sngags 'gugs pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba'i rgyal po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de nyid kyis gsal zhing rgyal bas na sku dang gsung dang thugs rmad du byung ba'i sngags 'gugs pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba'i rgyal po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Since it is illuminated by that very thing, and since it is victorious, it is the samadhi called the king of the manifestations of the summoning of the mantra of the marvelous body, speech, and mind.

original: de ston par byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs ni byang chub kyi sems kyi gos len par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir le'u'o //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs ni byang chub kyi sems kyi gos len par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir le'u'o //
translated: The collection of sounds that teach that are the characteristics of the robe of the mind of enlightenment. Therefore, it is a chapter.

original: le'u bcu bzhi pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bcu bzhi pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the explanation of the fourteenth chapter.

original: // /'di las bshad pa'i rmi lam la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thob cing sgom pa lhur len pa rnams kyis rigs kyi bye brag dang bu mo'i rigs na tshod kyi rnam par dbye ba dang rmi lam du lhag par dmigs pa'i sgo nas dngos grub thams cad 'grub par
analyzed: // /'di las bshad pa'i rmi lam la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thob cing sgom pa lhur len pa rnams kyis rigs kyi bye brag dang bu mo'i rigs na tshod kyi rnam par dbye ba dang rmi lam du lhag par dmigs pa'i sgo nas dngos grub thams cad 'grub par
translated: Those who have attained the signs of dreams and so forth explained in this [tantra], and who are intent on meditation, should accomplish all powers by means of the distinctions of family and the distinctions of age of the girl, and by means of the special observation in dreams.

original: bya ba yin pas de'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi dam tshig gi snying po'i rdo rje 'byung ba'i le'u /
analyzed: bya ba yin pas de'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi dam tshig gi snying po'i rdo rje 'byung ba'i le'u /
translated: Therefore, the chapter on the emergence of the essence of the commitment of all sentient beings is taught.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
translated: Then, etc.

original: mi bskyod @252b pa'i rang bzhin gyi thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyis mdzes pa na rgyal po'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod @252b pa'i rang bzhin gyi thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyis mdzes pa na rgyal po'o //
translated: The king is adorned with the pristine awareness of the realm of phenomena, which is the nature of Akshobhya, and is without beginning or end.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi bdag nyid kyi me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dngos grub thams cad kyi go skabs 'byed pas na thams cad nam mkha'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi bdag nyid kyi me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dngos grub thams cad kyi go skabs 'byed pas na thams cad nam mkha'o //
translated: All space is the opportunity for all powers, which is the mirror-like pristine awareness of the nature of Vairochana.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnam pa'i so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mi 'gyur bas na mi 'gyur che'o //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnam pa'i so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mi 'gyur bas na mi 'gyur che'o //
translated: It is the great unchanging because it is the nature of the discriminating knowledge in the aspect of Amitabha.

original: dkon mchog dpal gyi mtshan nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang mngon par 'brel ba'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad 'khrud par mdzad pas na thams cad dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: dkon mchog dpal gyi mtshan nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang mngon par 'brel ba'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad 'khrud par mdzad pas na thams cad dbang bskur ro //
translated: It is the consecration of all because it is connected with the knowledge of equality in the character of Ratnasambhava, and it purifies all the stains of the afflictions.

original: don yod pa'i rnam pa'i bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis 'gro ba ma lus pa'i bya ba yongs su mkhyen pas na kun mkhyen no //
analyzed: don yod pa'i rnam pa'i bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis 'gro ba ma lus pa'i bya ba yongs su mkhyen pas na kun mkhyen no //
translated: It is the omniscience because it is the knowledge of all the activities of all transmigrators by means of the knowledge of successful activities in the aspect of Amoghasiddhi.

original: tshig de rnams kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ye shes bsdus pa'i rang bzhin can gyi bcom ldan 'das bstan te /
analyzed: tshig de rnams kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ye shes bsdus pa'i rang bzhin can gyi bcom ldan 'das bstan te /
translated: By these words, the Bhagavat is taught to have the nature of the five transcendent lords’ knowledge.

original: des bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: des bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: He is the one who speaks.

original: sme sha can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sme sha can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The outcaste, etc.

original: rig pa'i brtul zhugs ji lta ba bzhin du spyad pa'i rnal 'byor pa rang gi dkyil 'khor na gnas pas sme sha can gyi bu mo lo bcu gnyis lon pa dang lhan cig bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i brtul zhugs ji lta ba bzhin du spyad pa'i rnal 'byor pa rang gi dkyil 'khor na gnas pas sme sha can gyi bu mo lo bcu gnyis lon pa dang lhan cig bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The yogi who practices the conduct of awareness as it is should practice together with a caṇḍālī girl who is twelve years old, who is in his own maṇḍala.

original: dben pa'i gnas su zhes bya ba ni dgon pa chen po la sogs par ro //
analyzed: dben pa'i gnas su zhes bya ba ni dgon pa chen po la sogs par ro //
translated: In an isolated place means in a great forest, and so on.

original: bshang ba'i dam tshig la sogs pas zhes bya bas ni ji skad bshad pa'i bdud rtsi lngas so //
analyzed: bshang ba'i dam tshig la sogs pas zhes bya bas ni ji skad bshad pa'i bdud rtsi lngas so //
translated: By means of the commitment of feces, and so on, means by means of the five amṛtas as explained.

original: cho ga bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: According to the rite means

original: 'phags pa bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa ste /
translated: endowed with the yoga of noble Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rten bsgoms nas de'i dbus su dkyil 'khor gru bzhi bya'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rten bsgoms nas de'i dbus su dkyil 'khor gru bzhi bya'o //
translated: Having meditated on the support of the maṇḍala of mind, in the center of that, one should make a square maṇḍala.

original: thams cad yongs su dag ces bya ba la sogs pas ni mthong ba la sogs pa rnams kyi sgo nas sems dga' bar byed pas 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad yongs su dag ces bya ba la sogs pas ni mthong ba la sogs pa rnams kyi sgo nas sems dga' bar byed pas 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: By means of all purities, and so on, it is taught that one will be successful by means of the delight of the mind through seeing, and so on.

original: pang bar bzhag nas rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: pang bar bzhag nas rnam par bsgom //
translated: Placing her in one’s lap, one should meditate.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du ji skad bshad pa'i gnas su bsrung ba'i cho ga sngon du 'gro ba can gyi khro bo 'phags pa bdud rtsi zhes bya ba'i rnal 'byor gyis btsun mo'i nam mkha'i dbyings su rnam par dag pa'i bdud rtsi lngas thugs kyi dkyil
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du ji skad bshad pa'i gnas su bsrung ba'i cho ga sngon du 'gro ba can gyi khro bo 'phags pa bdud rtsi zhes bya ba'i rnal 'byor gyis btsun mo'i nam mkha'i dbyings su rnam par dag pa'i bdud rtsi lngas thugs kyi dkyil
translated: This is to say, in the place described above, through the yoga of the wrathful noble nectar, preceded by the rite of protection, in the space of the queen, the five nectars are purified in the mind maṇḍala.🔽

original: 'khor gyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor gru bzhi byas la /
analyzed: 'khor gyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor gru bzhi byas la /
translated: This is to say, in the place described above, having first performed the rite of protection, by the yoga of the noble wrathful one called Amṛta, in the space of the consort, one should make a square maṇḍala, the nature of the mind maṇḍala, with the five pure nectars.

original: de'i dbus su stan 'jam po la nye bar 'dug ste /
analyzed: de'i dbus su stan 'jam po la nye bar 'dug ste /
translated: In the center of that, sitting on a soft seat,

original: sems can thams cad sdud par byed pa'i snying rje chen po'i sems bskyed @253a * //
analyzed: sems can thams cad sdud par byed pa'i snying rje chen po'i sems bskyed @253a * //
translated: one should generate the mind of great compassion that gathers all sentient beings.

original: pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa la thug pa byas la /
analyzed: pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa la thug pa byas la /
translated: Having first performed the consecration of the body and so on of Akṣobhya,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i bu mo ji lta ba bzhin du m'a ma k'i rnam par bsgoms pa dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i sgo nas las la gnas pas byang chub kyi sems phyung ste ;
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i bu mo ji lta ba bzhin du m'a ma k'i rnam par bsgoms pa dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i sgo nas las la gnas pas byang chub kyi sems phyung ste ;
translated: one should extract the bodhicitta by means of the rite of union with the girl, just as described above, who is visualized as Māmakī.

original: / de kho na bzhin du padma la gnas pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: / de kho na bzhin du padma la gnas pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par bsams la /
translated: Just so, one should imagine the moon disk situated in the lotus.

original: de las rang gi snying pos bskyed pa'i lha'i 'khor lo yi ge gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs pa phyung ste /
analyzed: de las rang gi snying pos bskyed pa'i lha'i 'khor lo yi ge gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs pa phyung ste /
translated: From that, one should visualize the circle of deities generated by one's essence, consecrated with the three seed syllables,

original: gnas ji lta ba bzhin du dgod cing dam tshig bzhis rgyas btab la ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i ting nge 'dzin sngon du 'gro ba can gyis bla na med pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa rnams kyis kun du mchod nas ji srid du ji skad bshad pa'i dngos
analyzed: gnas ji lta ba bzhin du dgod cing dam tshig bzhis rgyas btab la ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i ting nge 'dzin sngon du 'gro ba can gyis bla na med pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa rnams kyis kun du mchod nas ji srid du ji skad bshad pa'i dngos
translated: and situated in their respective places, sealed with the four seals, and worshipped with the offerings of the unsurpassed, etc., preceded by the concentration of the wisdom circle.

original: grub grub pa de srid du nyin dang mtshan du bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //🔽sku gsung thugs ni rdo rje can //
analyzed: grub grub pa de srid du nyin dang mtshan du bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no // sku gsung thugs ni rdo rje can //
translated: One should meditate day and night until one has achieved the powers as explained above.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sku dang gsung dang thugs mi phyed pa'i rnam par snang mdzad du bdag nyid bsgom pa bstan to /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sku dang gsung dang thugs mi phyed pa'i rnam par snang mdzad du bdag nyid bsgom pa bstan to /
translated: The line endowed with the vajra body, speech, and mind teaches that one should meditate on oneself as Vairocana, whose body, speech, and mind are indivisible.

original: de ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bsam gtan zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The yoga of concentration is stated.

original: snga ma bzhin du rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor gyis rnam par snang mdzad dbyung ba dang gzhug pa'i sgo nas yongs su gyur pa bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad du bsgom pas sbyor ba ni bsam gtan gyi sngags kyi sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor gyis rnam par snang mdzad dbyung ba dang gzhug pa'i sgo nas yongs su gyur pa bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad du bsgom pas sbyor ba ni bsam gtan gyi sngags kyi sbyor ba ste /
translated: As before, by the yoga of Great Vajradhara, one should meditate on oneself as Vairochana by way of the emergence and entry of Vairochana.

original: des rnam par snang mdzad dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des rnam par snang mdzad dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that yoga of concentration, one becomes like Vairochana.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of Vajrasattva,

original: zhes bya bas ni bshad ma thag pa'i mi bskyod pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni bshad ma thag pa'i mi bskyod pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: one should meditate on oneself as Akshobhya by the yoga of Akshobhya just explained.

original: autpala mthing ga'i mdog 'dra ba //
analyzed: autpala mthing ga'i mdog 'dra ba //
translated: The color of the blue lotus

original: zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i sme sha can gyi bu mo'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i sme sha can gyi bu mo'o //
translated: is the just explained daughter of a Chandala.

original: gal te ji las de ltar shes she na /
analyzed: gal te ji las de ltar shes she na /
translated: If one wonders how one knows that,

original: man ngag dang gzhung 'khrugs pa nyid las ta /
analyzed: man ngag dang gzhung 'khrugs pa nyid las ta /
translated: it is from the very confusion of the oral instructions and the text.

original: 'dir bshad pa'i btso blag mkhan gyi bu mo mdog dkar po /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa'i btso blag mkhan gyi bu mo mdog dkar po /
translated: Here, the daughter of a washerman is white in color.

original: ji ltar thugs kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i na tshod dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ji ltar thugs kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i na tshod dang ldan pa /
translated: One who has the age as explained in the mind mandala,

original: man ngag gis sku'i dkyil 'khor la sbyar ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: man ngag gis sku'i dkyil 'khor la sbyar ba de bzhin du /
translated: and is joined to the body mandala by the esoteric instructions,

original: 'dir bshad pa'i autpala mthing ga'i mdog 'dra ba'i sme sha can gyi bu mo lo bcu gnyis pa ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa'i autpala mthing ga'i mdog 'dra ba'i sme sha can gyi bu mo lo bcu gnyis pa ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: just so, here, the girl who is a cāṇḍālī, having the color like a blue lotus, who is twelve years old, should be joined to the mind mandala.

original: bu mo rtag tu bsgrub ces bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i 'phags ma sangs rgyas spyan du rnam par bsgoms pa rigs lnga dang bsre @253b ba byas nas so //
analyzed: bu mo rtag tu bsgrub ces bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i 'phags ma sangs rgyas spyan du rnam par bsgoms pa rigs lnga dang bsre @253b ba byas nas so //
translated: The girl who is always accomplished is the previously explained Noble Buddhalocanā, who is visualized as the five clans.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i bu mo dang yang dag par ldan pa'i snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor gyis bdag nyid du sku rdo rjer bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba de nyid bstan te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i bu mo dang yang dag par ldan pa'i snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor gyis bdag nyid du sku rdo rjer bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba de nyid bstan te /
translated: The one who is endowed with the previously explained girl, by means of the Vairocana yoga, should meditate on himself as the vajra body.

original: sbyor ba'i cho ga de nyid ni //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i cho ga de nyid ni //
translated: The procedure of union is just that.

original: zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
translated: The procedure of union is just that, as was just explained.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i 'od 'drar 'gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i 'od 'drar 'gyur //
translated: One becomes like the light of Vajrasattva.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rang gi sbyor bas mi bskyod pa grub pa de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad kyang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rang gi sbyor bas mi bskyod pa grub pa de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad kyang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that just as one becomes accomplished by one's own application, so also does Vairochana.

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa chos thams cad 'dzin par mdzad pas na chos 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa chos thams cad 'dzin par mdzad pas na chos 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The Dharma-holder is the one who holds all dharmas such as the powers and fearlessnesses.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i bu mo dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i sgo nas 'od dpag tu med pa bsgrub par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i bu mo dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i sgo nas 'od dpag tu med pa bsgrub par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since one should accomplish Amitabha by means of the union with the girl as explained, therefore

original: rdo rje chos ni rnam bsgoms pas //
analyzed: rdo rje chos ni rnam bsgoms pas //
translated: it is said, Meditating on Vajradharma,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: etc.

original: bsgrub ces bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'i sbyor ba nyid kyis bdag nyid 'od dpag tu med par ro //
analyzed: bsgrub ces bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'i sbyor ba nyid kyis bdag nyid 'od dpag tu med par ro //
translated: The accomplishment is oneself as Amitabha by means of the application of Akshobhya.

original: sa bcu la ni gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: sa bcu la ni gnas par 'gyur //
translated: One will abide in the ten stages.

original: zhes bya ba la gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa drug dang / sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa bzhi ste 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo rnams kho nas sa bcu ru brjod par bya ste /🔽sgeg mo ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa drug dang / sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa bzhi ste 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo rnams kho nas sa bcu ru brjod par bya ste / sgeg mo ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul bzhin du /
translated: Thus, the six goddesses beginning with Rūpavajrā and the four goddesses beginning with Buddhalocanā, who are the nature of the result, are said to be the ten stages.

original: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rnams yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rnams yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that Rūpavajrā and so forth are the Joyful and so forth, in the same way that Charm is the perfection of generosity and so forth.

original: de rnams yang dag par sbyor ba'i sgo nas bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du gnas pas na sa bcu la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams yang dag par sbyor ba'i sgo nas bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du gnas pas na sa bcu la gnas pa ste /
translated: They abide in the ten stages by abiding in the nature of great bliss through the process of their union.

original: de kho na nyid ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang mtshungs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa chung ba'i rnal 'byor pa yang ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa bzhin du sa bcu'i dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang mtshungs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa chung ba'i rnal 'byor pa yang ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa bzhin du sa bcu'i dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Since reality is just like a wish-fulfilling gem, the yogi with few desires becomes the lord of the ten stages just as he wishes.

original: gsung rdo rje'i dam tshig ni gsung gi dam tshig ste /
analyzed: gsung rdo rje'i dam tshig ni gsung gi dam tshig ste /
translated: The pledge of vajra speech is the speech pledge.

original: phyag rgya dam tshig ces bya bar brjod ces 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyag rgya dam tshig ces bya bar brjod ces 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: It is called the pledge seal,

original: de'i phyag rgya chen po yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyag rgya chen po yin zhing /
translated: because it is the great seal of that,

original: de 'dzin par mdzad pas na gsung gi dam tshig 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin par mdzad pas na gsung gi dam tshig 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and it is the holder of the pledge of speech, because it is the one who holds it.

original: khams gsum pa'i bde ba chen po'i bdag po yin pa'i phyir mnga' dbang dam pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i bde ba chen po'i bdag po yin pa'i phyir mnga' dbang dam pa'o //
translated: It is the supreme lord, because it is the lord of the great bliss of the three realms.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi mchog yin pas kun gyi mchog go //🔽de ltar rigs gsum gyi bye brag gis dngos grub bsgrub pa bshad nas /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi mchog yin pas kun gyi mchog go // de ltar rigs gsum gyi bye brag gis dngos grub bsgrub pa bshad nas /
translated: It is the supreme of all, because it is the supreme of all mandalas.

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bye brag gis bram ze zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bye brag gis bram ze zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having explained the accomplishment of feats by the distinctions of the three families, now, by the distinctions of the transcendent lords, he declares the brahmin, etc.

original: bram ze'i bu @254a * //
analyzed: bram ze'i bu @254a * //
translated: The son or daughter of a brahmin

original: mo dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i sgo nas ni rnam par snang mdzad bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: mo dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i sgo nas ni rnam par snang mdzad bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: should accomplish Vairochana by means of union with a brahmin girl.

original: de bzhin du rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs kyi bu mo rnams dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i sgo nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs kyi bu mo rnams dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i sgo nas /
translated: In the same way, he is the one who has united with the daughters of the warrior class, the priest class, and the commoner class.🔽

original: go rims bzhin du rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod par grub pa rnams kyis dngos grub sgrub par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod par grub pa rnams kyis dngos grub sgrub par shes par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should understand that one achieves power by means of union with a girl of the warrior caste, a girl of the priestly caste, and a girl of the commoner caste, respectively, with Ratnasaṃbha-va, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni rdo rje'i rigs gtso bor gyur pa'i sgo nas bdag po nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad dang yang dag par sbyor ba nyid kyi sgo nas bsgrub par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni rdo rje'i rigs gtso bor gyur pa'i sgo nas bdag po nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad dang yang dag par sbyor ba nyid kyi sgo nas bsgrub par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that one achieves power by means of union with all of them, since Great Vajradhara is the lord himself by virtue of being the chief of the Vajra caste.

original: de bzhin du rigs kyi bye brag gi sgo nas lha thams cad bsgrub par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs kyi bye brag gi sgo nas lha thams cad bsgrub par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus one should understand that one achieves all the deities by means of the differentiation of the castes.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid yin pas na rdo rje chos bdag ste sgrub pa pos so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid yin pas na rdo rje chos bdag ste sgrub pa pos so //
translated: The one who is the nature of the Dharma, such as Great Vajradhara, is the lord of the vajra, that is, the adept.

original: de nyid ni bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid ni bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
translated: That is explained by “that very one is to be achieved,” and so on.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom pa po'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom pa po'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The creation stage is from the point of view of the meditator.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i bsgrub pa'i dus nges pa ni /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i bsgrub pa'i dus nges pa ni /
translated: The time of practice, just explained, is definite from the perspective of the one who cultivates the creation stage.

original: rdo rje nyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
translated: The time of practice is taught by the words “the vajra sun,” and so forth.

original: 'dul ba la shes bzhin sngon du 'gro ba bzhin du rdo rje theg pa chen po la rdo rje sngon du 'gro ba can du brjod par bya ba yin pas nyi ma nyid rdo rje nyi ma ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba la shes bzhin sngon du 'gro ba bzhin du rdo rje theg pa chen po la rdo rje sngon du 'gro ba can du brjod par bya ba yin pas nyi ma nyid rdo rje nyi ma ste /
translated: Just as in the Vinaya, heedfulness is required beforehand, so too in the Great Vehicle of the Vajrayāna, the vajra is required beforehand. Therefore, the sun itself is the vajra sun.

original: de nub par gyur nas bsgom pa bya'o //
analyzed: de nub par gyur nas bsgom pa bya'o //
translated: When it has set, one should meditate.

original: skya rengs ni nyi ma'i shing rta khrid pa ste /
analyzed: skya rengs ni nyi ma'i shing rta khrid pa ste /
translated: The dawn is the one who leads the chariot of the sun.

original: de 'char ba'i dus su zhag bdun tshun chad kyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'char ba'i dus su zhag bdun tshun chad kyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of its rising, one will be successful within seven days.

original: rtag tu rnal 'byor la gnas pa la ni dus nges pa med pas gzhan du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rtag tu rnal 'byor la gnas pa la ni dus nges pa med pas gzhan du brjod par bya ste /
translated: For one who always abides in yoga, the time is indefinite, so it should be stated otherwise.

original: sems can thams cad kun du sdud par byed pa'i snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin nyid dang / mi shes pa'i mun pa 'joms par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kun du sdud par byed pa'i snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin nyid dang / mi shes pa'i mun pa 'joms par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the nature of great compassion that gathers all sentient beings and because it destroys the darkness of ignorance,

original: rang gi gsang ba'i rdo rje nyid ni rdo rje nyi ma'o //
analyzed: rang gi gsang ba'i rdo rje nyid ni rdo rje nyi ma'o //
translated: One’s own secret vajra is the vajra sun.

original: de nub nas te btsun mo'i nam mkha'i dbyings su nub nas so //
analyzed: de nub nas te btsun mo'i nam mkha'i dbyings su nub nas so //
translated: It sets, that is, it sets in the space of the bhaga.

original: skya rengs ni byang chub sems te de 'char ba ni 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skya rengs ni byang chub sems te de 'char ba ni 'byung ba'o //
translated: The dawn is the bodhicitta, and its rising is its emission.

original: de bas ni des ni 'di skad bshad pa yin te ;
analyzed: de bas ni des ni 'di skad bshad pa yin te ;
translated: Therefore, this is what is being said:

original: rtag tu lha'i nga rgyal dang ldan zhing rang gi rigs kyi bu mo dang snyoms par zhugs pas spro ba la sogs pa mi bya zhing chung zad 'bar ba'i byang chub kyi sems mi dbyung bar bsgoms na /
analyzed: rtag tu lha'i nga rgyal dang ldan zhing rang gi rigs kyi bu mo dang snyoms par zhugs pas spro ba la sogs pa mi bya zhing chung zad 'bar ba'i byang chub kyi sems mi dbyung bar bsgoms na /
translated: One who is always endowed with divine pride, and who is in union with a daughter of one’s own clan, should not emit the bodhicitta through the doors of desire, and so on, but should meditate without emitting the slightly blazing bodhicitta.

original: byang chub kyi sems dbyung ba brtan pa nyid du gyur nas gdon mi za bar de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya @254b ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dbyung ba brtan pa nyid du gyur nas gdon mi za bar de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya @254b ba'i don to //
translated: If the bodhicitta is emitted, it will become stable, and it will certainly become its nature.

original: rnal 'byor pas ni byang chub sems //🔽ji srid gtong bar mi byed pa //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ni byang chub sems // ji srid gtong bar mi byed pa //
translated: The yogi should not emit the bodhicitta🔽for as long as he does not wish to.

original: de srid rgyun mi 'chad par du //
analyzed: de srid rgyun mi 'chad par du //
translated: For as long as he does not emit it,

original: dga' skyes bde ba dga' thob 'gyur //
analyzed: dga' skyes bde ba dga' thob 'gyur //
translated: he will attain the bliss of the joy of the arising of bliss.

original: skad cig rnam par yang dag byung //
analyzed: skad cig rnam par yang dag byung //
translated: It arises in an instant,

original: spro dang sdud par byed pa ste //
analyzed: spro dang sdud par byed pa ste //
translated: And it causes expansion and contraction.

original: 'di ni sa 'og sa steng bla //
analyzed: 'di ni sa 'og sa steng bla //
translated: It is the best of the underworld and the earth,

original: rgyu dang mi rgyu kun gsal byed //
analyzed: rgyu dang mi rgyu kun gsal byed //
translated: Illuminating all that is moving and unmoving.

original: de yi rang bzhin ro myang ba //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin ro myang ba //
translated: Its nature is to taste the experience,

original: dbang bo las 'das thob pa ni //🔽'di de zhes ni de brjod par //
analyzed: dbang bo las 'das thob pa ni // 'di de zhes ni de brjod par //
translated: And it is attained beyond the senses.🔽Even the Buddha cannot describe it

original: sangs rgyas kyis kyang mi spyod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis kyang mi spyod do //
translated: By saying, “This is it.”

original: rtag cing khyab bdag mchog zhi ba //
analyzed: rtag cing khyab bdag mchog zhi ba //
translated: It is permanent, all-pervading, supreme, and peaceful,

original: rgyu dang dpe rnams spangs pa ste //
analyzed: rgyu dang dpe rnams spangs pa ste //
translated: Free from causes and examples,

original: yod med las ni rnam par grol //
analyzed: yod med las ni rnam par grol //
translated: Free from existence and nonexistence,

original: gnyis med gnas ni dam pa ste //
analyzed: gnyis med gnas ni dam pa ste //
translated: The supreme abode of nonduality,

original: dngos grub kun gyi gter gyur pa //
analyzed: dngos grub kun gyi gter gyur pa //
translated: The treasure of all powers.

original: byang chub sems ni lhung gyur nas //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni lhung gyur nas //
translated: When the bodhicitta falls,

original: rnam shes phung po brgyal gyur na //
analyzed: rnam shes phung po brgyal gyur na //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness faints,

original: smad min dngos grub ga la yod //
analyzed: smad min dngos grub ga la yod //
translated: And how can there be any power that is not supreme?

original: ces kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: ces kyang gsungs so //
translated: It is also said:

original: rgyan rnams thams cad yongs su rdzogs //
analyzed: rgyan rnams thams cad yongs su rdzogs //
translated: It is complete with all the ornaments.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes par zad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes par zad do //
translated: And so on. The rest is self-evident.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i mchog ste gtso bo'i 'phags ma kun du bzang mor rnam par bsgoms pa'i sme sha can la sogs pa'i bu mo ni rdo rje sems dpa' mchog go //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i mchog ste gtso bo'i 'phags ma kun du bzang mor rnam par bsgoms pa'i sme sha can la sogs pa'i bu mo ni rdo rje sems dpa' mchog go //
translated: The girl who is a candali, etc., is the supreme Vajrasattva, visualized as the sublime Samantabhadri, the chief of the great Vajradhara.

original: myur du zhes bya ba ni mgyogs par te zhag bdun gyi nang du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: myur du zhes bya ba ni mgyogs par te zhag bdun gyi nang du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Quickly means rapidly, in the sense of within seven days.

original: 'di ni sku gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sku gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: This is the three bodies, etc. is easy to understand.

original: bang par bzhag nas rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: bang par bzhag nas rnam par bsgom //
translated: Having placed it in the organ, one should visualize it.🔽In order to clarify just that,

original: zhes gang bshad pa de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: he says,

original: dbang po gnyis ni sbyor ba yis //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang po gnyis ni sbyor ba yis // zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
translated: The union of the two organs, etc.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i dam tshig nyams su blang ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa bsgoms pas dge legs kyi go 'phang thob par 'gyur bas de'i phyir ;
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i dam tshig nyams su blang ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa bsgoms pas dge legs kyi go 'phang thob par 'gyur bas de'i phyir ;
translated: By practicing the commitments as explained and cultivating the meditative stabilization, one attains the state of auspiciousness. Therefore,🔽he says,

original: / bshang gci'i dam tshig la sogs pas //
analyzed: / bshang gci'i dam tshig la sogs pas //
translated: By the commitment of excrement, urine, etc.,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: 'dod pa bsten pa dang dam tshig nyams su blang ba'i sgo nas yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa las grol ba ston par mdzad pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang thar pa'i dam tshig rdo rje ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa bsten pa dang dam tshig nyams su blang ba'i sgo nas yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa las grol ba ston par mdzad pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang thar pa'i dam tshig rdo rje ste /
translated: The pledge of desire and liberation is taught in order to show that one is liberated from the concepts of existence and nonexistence by relying on desire and by practicing the pledges.🔽

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The vajra of the pledge of desire and liberation is glorious Vajrasattva, because he is the teacher who liberates from the concepts of existence and nonexistence by means of the practice of desire and the practice of the pledge.

original: kang gi tshe ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rang gi rigs kyi bu mo rnams dang / de'i rigs can rnams la yang dang yang du gsol ba btab pas ma thob pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: kang gi tshe ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rang gi rigs kyi bu mo rnams dang / de'i rigs can rnams la yang dang yang du gsol ba btab pas ma thob pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one has not obtained the girl of one's own caste who has the characteristics explained above, and also those of her caste, by repeatedly supplicating her,

original: de rangs par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de rangs par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: then one should please her. Therefore, the Bhagavān declares, “Then, etc.”

original: dam tshig chen po'i khro bo ni 'phags pa @255a * //🔽gshin rje gshed de /
analyzed: dam tshig chen po'i khro bo ni 'phags pa @255a * // gshin rje gshed de /
translated: The great pledge-wrathful one is the ārya Yamāri.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mi phyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mi phyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The samādhi that focuses on him is called that because it is indivisible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje rnams kyis 'chi bdag gi bdud la sogs pa skrag par byed pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje kun du skrag par byed pa'i khro bo ste de'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje rnams kyis 'chi bdag gi bdud la sogs pa skrag par byed pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje kun du skrag par byed pa'i khro bo ste de'o //
translated: Since all the vajras of all the tathagatas terrify the demon of death, etc., he is the wrathful one who terrifies all the vajras of all the tathagatas.

original: khro zhing tsher ma'i me la bsreg / ces bya bas ni 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /🔽ji lta ba bzhin du mngon du bsnyen pa byas pa snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'phags pa gshin rje'i gshed kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan zhing khro bas mngon spyod kyi thab khung gru gsum tsher ma can gyi bud shing gis sbar bar yi ge h'um las byung ba'i lce
analyzed: khro zhing tsher ma'i me la bsreg / ces bya bas ni 'di skad du bstan pa yin te / ji lta ba bzhin du mngon du bsnyen pa byas pa snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'phags pa gshin rje'i gshed kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan zhing khro bas mngon spyod kyi thab khung gru gsum tsher ma can gyi bud shing gis sbar bar yi ge h'um las byung ba'i lce
translated: The verse, “wrathful, burning in a fire of thorns,” teaches the following.

original: dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa gshin rje'i gshed kyi zhal du stobs pas /
analyzed: dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa gshin rje'i gshed kyi zhal du stobs pas /
translated: The arya Yamantaka, who is the object of proper direct realization, is the yoga of the arya Yamantaka who has entered into meditative equipoise. He is wrathful, and his tongue, which arises from the syllable hum, is blazing in the fire of thorns in the triangular pit of the destructive rite.🔽He is the arya Yamantaka, who is the face of the arya Yamantaka.

original: aom hr'i: shtri: wi kri t'a na na bu mo che ge mo stam bha ya h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom hr'i: shtri: wi kri t'a na na bu mo che ge mo stam bha ya h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: The mantra is: “Om hrih shtambhaya hrim hrim phat svāhā.

original: zhes bya ba zlos shing nyi ma phyed dam mtshan phyed kyi dus su dug la sogs pa'i sbyin sreg stong rtsa brgyad zhag gsum byas na bu mo de gdon mi za bar rengs par 'gyur zhing gzhan la ster bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba zlos shing nyi ma phyed dam mtshan phyed kyi dus su dug la sogs pa'i sbyin sreg stong rtsa brgyad zhag gsum byas na bu mo de gdon mi za bar rengs par 'gyur zhing gzhan la ster bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Reciting this, at noon or midnight, one should perform the homa of poison, etc., for eight thousand three days. Then that girl will certainly be paralyzed and will not be given to another.

original: bskal ba grangs med gsum du yang //
analyzed: bskal ba grangs med gsum du yang //
translated: Even for three incalculable eons,

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te de'i tshe nang na tshod yod na'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te de'i tshe nang na tshod yod na'o //
translated: if she is still young at that time.

original: sangs rgyas sam ni chos 'dzin pa'am //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sam ni chos 'dzin pa'am //
translated: If she is a buddha or upholder of the Dharma,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes can gyi 'das par gyur kyang 'tsho bar mi 'gyur ro zhes la dor ba brjod pa'i sgo nas sbyor ba'i che ba'i bdag nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes can gyi 'das par gyur kyang 'tsho bar mi 'gyur ro zhes la dor ba brjod pa'i sgo nas sbyor ba'i che ba'i bdag nyid gsungs so //
translated: etc. means that even if she becomes a non-conceptual wisdom holder, she will not live. By expressing this, the greatness of the practice is stated.

original: de ni rtag tu ster bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu ster bar 'gyur //
translated: That will always be given.

original: zhes bya ba ni mar ngo'i zhag dag las gang yang rung ba'i nyin par /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mar ngo'i zhag dag las gang yang rung ba'i nyin par /
translated: This is on any day of the waning phase.

original: dur khrod kyi sol ba blangs te 'phags pa gshin rje'i gshed kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas stong rtsa brgyad bzlas pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi sol ba blangs te 'phags pa gshin rje'i gshed kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas stong rtsa brgyad bzlas pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Taking charnel ground char, one should recite the mantra one thousand and eight times, endowed with the yoga of Ārya-Yamāri.

original: bdag la bu mo 'di byin cig ces bya ba'i bskul ba'i tshig dang ldan pa'i bshad ma thag pa'i sngags dang rnam par spel ba'i tshangs pa dang srin po la sogs pa gang gi ming bris pa des de bkug nas ster bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la bu mo 'di byin cig ces bya ba'i bskul ba'i tshig dang ldan pa'i bshad ma thag pa'i sngags dang rnam par spel ba'i tshangs pa dang srin po la sogs pa gang gi ming bris pa des de bkug nas ster bar byed pa'o //
translated: One should write the name of the one who is to be summoned, such as Brahmā or a rākṣasa, with the mantra just explained, which has the words of the invocation, Give me this girl! and so forth. The one whose name is written will be summoned and will give [what is desired].

original: dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan bris nas ni //
analyzed: dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan bris nas ni //
translated: Having drawn the image of the enemy,

original: zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rim pas mngon par bzlas pa'i sol ba nyid kyis dur khrod kyi sa gzhi la bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan kun du bris te bkug la 'di'i ske gcad par bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pas @255b tam tsa mtshon cha'i🔽rnam par lhag par mos par byas nas /

translated: one should draw the image of the victim on charnel ground ground with the very char that has been enchanted with the previously explained procedure. Having summoned [the victim], thinking, I will cut his throat, one should imagine the weapon🔽 in the form of a line on his throat.

original: ske la ri mo bris na mgo chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ske la ri mo bris na mgo chad par 'gyur ba'o //

original: tho ba bsam gtan sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: tho ba bsam gtan sbyor ba yis //

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i rnal 'byor nyid kyis lag par 'phags pa gshin rje'i gshed kyi rang bzhin gyi thob ba bsams la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i rnal 'byor nyid kyis lag par 'phags pa gshin rje'i gshed kyi rang bzhin gyi thob ba bsams la /
translated: This means that by the yoga of that [Vajrapāṇi], one should imagine a hammer in one's hand, the nature of Noble Yāma.

original: mdun du bsgrub bya rnam par bsams te /
analyzed: mdun du bsgrub bya rnam par bsams te /
translated: Imagining the victim in front,

analyzed: tam lus la phab na gdon mi za bar slar ldang mi nus par ltung bar 'gyur ba'o //

original: h'um ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhe sdang rdo rje la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i rdo rje'i rigs kyi khro bo'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas rang gi lag tu yi ge h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse lnga ba 'bar ba 'od zer gyi🔽tshogs 'phro ba bsams la /
analyzed: h'um ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhe sdang rdo rje la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i rdo rje'i rigs kyi khro bo'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas rang gi lag tu yi ge h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse lnga ba 'bar ba 'od zer gyi tshogs 'phro ba bsams la /
translated: By Hūṃ and so forth, one who possesses the yoga of any wrathful one of the Vajra family such as Hatred Vajra, should imagine a five-pointed blazing vajra arisen from the letter Hūṃ in one's hand, a mass of light rays spreading out.

original: de kho na bzhin du bsgrub bya'i lus la nges par phab na gdon mi za ba kho nar 'jig par 'gyur bar bstan to //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du bsgrub bya'i lus la nges par phab na gdon mi za ba kho nar 'jig par 'gyur bar bstan to //
translated: In that very way, if one definitely brings it down on the body of the victim, one will certainly be destroyed.

original: de'i phyir phyag na rdo rje'i rigs la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyag na rdo rje'i rigs la zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, in the Vajrapāṇi family.

original: rdo rgyus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rdo rgyus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the words with a stone, etc.,

original: bshad ma thag pa'i rnal 'byor nyid kyis rdo rgyus dang sol ba la sogs pa rnams kyis ji skad du bshad pa bzhin du bsgrub bya kun du bris la bkug ste /🔽h'um ka ra las byung ba'i sta re rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i rnal 'byor nyid kyis rdo rgyus dang sol ba la sogs pa rnams kyis ji skad du bshad pa bzhin du bsgrub bya kun du bris la bkug ste / h'um ka ra las byung ba'i sta re rnam par bsams la /
translated: one should draw the victim with a stone, charcoal, etc., as explained, by means of the yoga just explained, and summon him.

original: des de'i mid pa bcad na 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des de'i mid pa bcad na 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should imagine an axe arisen from Humkara, and with it cut off his head; he will be cut off.

original: sangs rgyas sku gsum rin chen mchog //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku gsum rin chen mchog //
translated: The jewel of the three Buddha-bodies etc.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas ni sgrub pa po la yid ches pa nyid skyed par byed do //🔽char ches pa'am dkyil 'khor 'dri ba'i dus su char rengs par bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas ni sgrub pa po la yid ches pa nyid skyed par byed do // char ches pa'am dkyil 'khor 'dri ba'i dus su char rengs par bya ba ni /
translated: causes the practitioner to generate confidence.

original: las kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: las kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
translated: In the case of excessive rain, or when it is time to draw the mandala, one should stop the rain with the words the karmavajra, etc.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po sku mdog ser po'i rnal 'byor gyis grong dang yul la sogs pa'i steng gi bar snang la yi ge h'um las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje 'bar ba kha dog ser po mngon par 'dod pa'i yul khebs par rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po sku mdog ser po'i rnal 'byor gyis grong dang yul la sogs pa'i steng gi bar snang la yi ge h'um las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje 'bar ba kha dog ser po mngon par 'dod pa'i yul khebs par rnam par bsams la /
translated: By the yoga of Great Vajradhara, yellow in color, one should imagine a blazing, variegated vajra cross, the color of gold, arisen from the syllable hūṃ, in the sky above the town, country, and so on, covering the desired place.

original: de'i dbus su yi ge h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje chen po kha gyen du bltas pa bskal pa'i mo'i phung po dad mtshungs par bsams nas /
analyzed: de'i dbus su yi ge h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje chen po kha gyen du bltas pa bskal pa'i mo'i phung po dad mtshungs par bsams nas /
translated: In the center of that, one should imagine a great vajra cross, arisen from the syllable hūṃ, facing upward, equal to the mass of the fire at the end of the eon.

original: de'i lte bar rnal 'byor de nyid kyis nye bar 'dug ste /
analyzed: de'i lte bar rnal 'byor de nyid kyis nye bar 'dug ste /
translated: In the center of that, the yogī himself should sit.

original: rang gi ba spu'i bu ga'i gseb nas byung ba'i 'od zer ser po'i tshogs rnams kyis thams cad bkab par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ba spu'i bu ga'i gseb nas byung ba'i 'od zer ser po'i tshogs rnams kyis thams cad bkab par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that a mass of yellow light rays arises from the pores of one's body and covers everything.

original: de ltar na mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas las phyi rol du char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas las phyi rol du char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, rain will fall outside of the desired place.

original: des ni mngon par 'dod pa'i @256a * //
analyzed: des ni mngon par 'dod pa'i @256a * //
translated: By that, the desired

original: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnal 'byor pas byas pa'i char mi 'bab pa dang phyi rol du char 'bab pa'i mthu gnyis bstan pa'i sgo nas sngags kyi che ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnal 'byor pas byas pa'i char mi 'bab pa dang phyi rol du char 'bab pa'i mthu gnyis bstan pa'i sgo nas sngags kyi che ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: The greatness of mantra is taught by means of the two powers: not causing rain to fall in the maṇḍala, etc., and causing rain to fall outside.

original: thams cad du gcad par 'dod na de nyid thams cad du khyab pa bsams la /
analyzed: thams cad du gcad par 'dod na de nyid thams cad du khyab pa bsams la /
translated: If one wishes to cut off everywhere, one should imagine that [the wind] pervades everywhere,

original: 'od zer 'bar ba'i tshogs rnams kyis klu thams cad yongs su bskams par bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyams su myang ba dang bcas pa'i man ngag go //

translated: and imagine that all nāgas are completely dried up by the mass of blazing light rays. This is the esoteric instruction with experience.

original: bsgom pa bya bar mi nus pa la bya ba'i cho ga brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa bya bar mi nus pa la bya ba'i cho ga brjod par bya ste /
translated: For one who is unable to perform the meditation, the procedure of the action should be stated.

original: sngar bshad pa'i bri ba'i rdzas rnams kyis dur khrod kyi gos la padma'i 'dab ma brgyad du rang gi sa bon gyis klu brgyad dang de'i lte bar yi ge phat kyis mtshan pa'i rlung lha kun du bris la bkug ste /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i bri ba'i rdzas rnams kyis dur khrod kyi gos la padma'i 'dab ma brgyad du rang gi sa bon gyis klu brgyad dang de'i lte bar yi ge phat kyis mtshan pa'i rlung lha kun du bris la bkug ste /
translated: On charnel ground cloth with the substances for drawing explained above, one should draw the eight nāgas with their own seeds on eight lotus petals, and in the center, the wind god marked with the syllable phaṭ. Having summoned [them],

translated: Also, draw a second garment, a yellow vajra cross pervaded by blazing light, in the center of which is a standing yellow five-pronged vajra marked with the syllable hūṃ.

original: gyen du bltas pa de'i steng du sbub ste kha sbyar la rdo leb kyis mnan te bzhag na char 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyen du bltas pa de'i steng du sbub ste kha sbyar la rdo leb kyis mnan te bzhag na char 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one looks upward and places the mouth of that [vajra cross] on top of that [garment], and places it and presses it down with a flat stone, the rain will cease.

original: gdug pa ni bgegs rnams yin zhing de dag 'joms par byed pas na gdug pa'i dgra ste /
analyzed: gdug pa ni bgegs rnams yin zhing de dag 'joms par byed pas na gdug pa'i dgra ste /
translated: The enemy of the wicked is the one who destroys the wicked obstructors.

original: 'phags pa bgegs ma thar byed yin zhing de'i rnal 'byor gyis mche ba'i phyag rgya yang bcings la /
analyzed: 'phags pa bgegs ma thar byed yin zhing de'i rnal 'byor gyis mche ba'i phyag rgya yang bcings la /
translated: The noble one is the one who liberates from obstructors, and one should bind the fang mudrā of his yoga.

original: rlung la sogs pa'i bgegs bsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i bgegs bsal bar bya ste /
translated: One should remove the obstructors of wind and so forth.

original: sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can mche ba'i phyag rgya kha'i logs kyi mtha' mar 'dzin cing yi ge phat zlos pas bgegs rnams kyi mdun du bstan na de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pas sprul pa'i rlung la sogs pa'i bgegs kyang sel bar byed do //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can mche ba'i phyag rgya kha'i logs kyi mtha' mar 'dzin cing yi ge phat zlos pas bgegs rnams kyi mdun du bstan na de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pas sprul pa'i rlung la sogs pa'i bgegs kyang sel bar byed do //
translated: The mudra of the fangs, which has the previously explained characteristics, is held at the edge of the mouth, and by repeating the syllable phat, when it is shown in front of the obstructors, even the obstructors of wind and so forth emanated by the Tathagatas and so forth are removed.

original: de nyid ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
translated: That is stated by “Buddha” and so forth.

analyzed: gzhan du na dam tshig las 'das pas rlung la sogs pa 'jig par 'gyur ba kho na'o //

original: de ltar phyag rgya'i phan yon bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyag rgya'i phan yon bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the benefits of the mudra,

original: da ni sngags kyi mthu /
analyzed: da ni sngags kyi mthu /
translated: now, the power of the mantra

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: is stated by “Buddha” and so forth.

original: de ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de ni go sla'o //

analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po bsgrub pa ni ye shes sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /

analyzed: ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi sems dpa' ni ye shes sems dpa'o //
translated: The awareness being is the awareness-being.

analyzed: de'i sbyor ba ni dam tshig sems dpa' dang lhan cig gcig tu bya ba ste de yis so //
translated: Its application is the performance of the single act together with the pledge-being.

analyzed: dbus su gzugs zhes bya ba ni ji skad @256b bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su thugs kar ye shes kyi lhas byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs brnyan no // sngags shes pas ni gnas bzhi ru //
translated: The form in the center is the image of Great Vajradhara consecrated by the wisdom deity in the heart in the center of the mandala as explained.🔽One who knows the mantra should always place the four
