analyzed: khams gsum pa 'di ni rnam par rig pa kho na'o zhes phyi rol gyi don gsal nas /
translated: “This threefold world is only consciousness,” having clarified the external object,

original: sems kyang yul na mi gnas pa /
analyzed: sems kyang yul na mi gnas pa /
translated: “the mind also does not abide in the object,

original: gzugs can ma yin pa /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa /
translated: it is not material,

original: bstan du med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam par dpyad de nam mkha' bzhin du rang bzhin med pa'o snyam du nges pa'o ;
analyzed: bstan du med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam par dpyad de nam mkha' bzhin du rang bzhin med pa'o snyam du nges pa'o ;
translated: it is not demonstrable,” etc., having analyzed it, one ascertains that it is like space, i.e., it is essenceless.

original: / chos thams cad de rmi lam du nye bar dmigs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / khams gsum pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin rnams rab tu gnas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / chos thams cad de rmi lam du nye bar dmigs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / khams gsum pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin rnams rab tu gnas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “All phenomena,” i.e., the forms of the Buddhas, etc., that are perceived in dreams, and the natures of the thoughts of the threefold world, “are well-established,” i.e., they are well-known.

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems la rnam par gnas pa yin pas de'i phyir /🔽nam mkha'i @266b rdo rje gnas chos 'di //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems la rnam par gnas pa yin pas de'i phyir / nam mkha'i @266b rdo rje gnas chos 'di //
translated: Since it is the mind that has the characteristic of space, therefore

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “The abode of the vajra of space is this Dharma.”

original: chos med ces bya ba ni kun du brtags pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: chos med ces bya ba ni kun du brtags pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: “No Dharma” means the natures of imagined things.

original: chos nyid med pa zhes bya ba ni de rnams nyid ma grub pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyang med pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid med pa zhes bya ba ni de rnams nyid ma grub pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyang med pa'o //
translated: “No reality” means that since they are not established, emptiness also does not exist.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Then, etc. has been explained.

original: dngos grub kyi mtshan ma'i rmi lam dang de bzlog pa gsan nas ngo mtshar dang rmad du gyur pa 'thob pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku la sogs pa'i the tshom gcod pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po la zhus pa ni /
analyzed: dngos grub kyi mtshan ma'i rmi lam dang de bzlog pa gsan nas ngo mtshar dang rmad du gyur pa 'thob pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku la sogs pa'i the tshom gcod pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po la zhus pa ni /
translated: Having heard the dream signs of spiritual powers and their reversal, those who attain wonder and amazement ask Great Vajradhara, who resolves doubts about the body, etc. of all the Tathāgatas,

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Bhagavān, what is it?” etc.

original: ngo bo med pa la zhes bya ba ni gal te dngos po thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa yin na /
analyzed: ngo bo med pa la zhes bya ba ni gal te dngos po thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa yin na /
translated: As for “in the absence of an essence,” if all things are like space,

original: de'i tshe khyod kyis rmi lam gyi mtshan ma rigs lnga sgrub pa'i chos kyi de kho na nyid rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar mdzad /
analyzed: de'i tshe khyod kyis rmi lam gyi mtshan ma rigs lnga sgrub pa'i chos kyi de kho na nyid rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar mdzad /
translated: then how is it that you, the one who has the dream signs, have set forth the reality of the Dharma of the five families?

original: rnam par gzhag pa yang mdzad de de'i phyir chos rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa yang mdzad de de'i phyir chos rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: And you have set it forth, so things do not lack an essence.

original: ae ma'o ngo mtshar las byung ba //
analyzed: ae ma'o ngo mtshar las byung ba //
translated: Amazing!

original: nam mkha' la ni nam mkha' bsgom //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni nam mkha' bsgom //
translated: Space meditates on space.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: gnyi ga yang med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkhas nam mkha' bsgom par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkhas nam mkha' bsgom par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Since both are non-existent, space is not able to meditate on space.

original: de ltar phyogs snga ma byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs snga ma byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la /
translated: Having thus presented the opponent’s position, the Bhagavān said,

original: nam mkha' ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Space is not a thing, etc.”

original: rdzas thams cad med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi nam mkha'i dbyings ni chos gang dang yang rtag tu mi ldan zhing /
analyzed: rdzas thams cad med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi nam mkha'i dbyings ni chos gang dang yang rtag tu mi ldan zhing /
translated: The realm of space, whose nature is the nonexistence of all substances, is never associated with any phenomenon.

original: kun rdzob tu dngos po thams cad de las 'byung ba'i phyir nam mkha' ni mi ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu dngos po thams cad de las 'byung ba'i phyir nam mkha' ni mi ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But space is not nonassociated, because all things arise from it conventionally.

original: nam mkha' de dag ni chos thams cad du gtogs la thams cad kyi rjes su lta'o snyam du yang mi sems te /
analyzed: nam mkha' de dag ni chos thams cad du gtogs la thams cad kyi rjes su lta'o snyam du yang mi sems te /
translated: They do not think, “Space is included in all things and looks on at everything,”

original: rdzas su med pa nyid yin pas nga rgyal la sogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas su med pa nyid yin pas nga rgyal la sogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist as a substance, and pride, etc., are impossible.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya bas nges par bzung nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la gsungs pa rmi lam zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi mtshan ma ston par byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya bas nges par bzung nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la gsungs pa rmi lam zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi mtshan ma ston par byed pa rnams so //
translated: Having specified that in the same way, the Tathāgatas taught that dreams are dream images.

original: rmi lam gyi dam tshig las byung ba zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi rgyud la rmi lam gyi rgyud las nges par byung ba'i sku rdo rje la sogs pa 'bras bu'i rang bzhin rnams te de rnams kyang nam mkha' bzhin du rjes su rtogs @267a *
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dam tshig las byung ba zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi rgyud la rmi lam gyi rgyud las nges par byung ba'i sku rdo rje la sogs pa 'bras bu'i rang bzhin rnams te de rnams kyang nam mkha' bzhin du rjes su rtogs @267a *
translated: The arisen from the pledge of dream is the nature of the result, the vajra body, etc., arisen from the continuum of the dream continuum of sentient beings, and those should be realized as like space.

original: // par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: // par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: rmi lam las yang dag par byung ba'i dngos grub rnams kyis gzung ba la sogs pa'i dngos po bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rmi lam las yang dag par byung ba'i dngos grub rnams kyis gzung ba la sogs pa'i dngos po bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to remove the substantiality of the accomplishments arisen from the dream,

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i tshig rnams kyis ni yang dang yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bod pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i tshig rnams kyis ni yang dang yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bod pa'o //
translated: the words beginning with the Blessed One are the requests again and again to the Tathagatas.

original: nam mkha' la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nam mkha' la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for in the sky, etc.,

original: gzung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir brtag tu med pa'o //🔽blta bar bya ba mi nus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir brtag tu med pa'o // blta bar bya ba mi nus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: it is not an object of investigation because it is free from the nature of substantiality, etc.

original: bltar mi snang ba ste /
analyzed: bltar mi snang ba ste /
translated: It is not an object of sight because it is not possible to see it.🔽It is not an object of hearing because it is not possible to hear it.

original: sa thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ba kho na'o //
analyzed: sa thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ba kho na'o //
translated: All the stages are just like that.

original: lus dang dag dang sems dang chos thams cad dang rdo rje'i gnas kyi dam tshig ni thams cad kyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus dang dag dang sems dang chos thams cad dang rdo rje'i gnas kyi dam tshig ni thams cad kyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The pledge of the vajra-points of body, speech, mind, and all phenomena is called “pervading all.”

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i khams gsum pa thams cad kyi rjes su song ba sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid gcig pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i khams gsum pa thams cad kyi rjes su song ba sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid gcig pa'o //
translated: Pervading all the three realms of the animate and inanimate is the single essence of the nature of the vajra body and so forth.

original: 'di lta ste sems kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba la sems ni bshad zin pa'i mtshan nyid can te de'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sems kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba la sems ni bshad zin pa'i mtshan nyid can te de'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is like this: the nature of mind. Mind is the one explained to have the characteristic of the mind, and that is its nature.

original: de nyid ni lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid ni lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
translated: That is stated by “body” and so forth.

original: lus la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang nam mkha'i rang bzhin de dag ni gnyis su med de /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang nam mkha'i rang bzhin de dag ni gnyis su med de /
translated: The nature of body and so forth and the nature of space are nondual.

original: skabs 'dir ni khams zhes bya ba'i sgra rang bzhin la 'jug go ;
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni khams zhes bya ba'i sgra rang bzhin la 'jug go ;
translated: In this context, the term “realm” is used for “nature.”

original: / sems can thams cad ni nam mkha'i khams la gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shin tu gsal lo //🔽byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: / sems can thams cad ni nam mkha'i khams la gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shin tu gsal lo // byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: All sentient beings abide in the realm of space.

original: me long lta bu la sogs pa mi phyed pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i rten du gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes 'byung ba rdo rje'i gnas byed pa'o //
analyzed: me long lta bu la sogs pa mi phyed pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i rten du gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes 'byung ba rdo rje'i gnas byed pa'o //
translated: The arising of the gnosis of all tathāgatas is the vajra site, because it is the basis for the arising of the gnosis of the mirror and so on.

original: byang chub kyi sems de yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: That thought of awakening, moreover,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir yul la sogs pa la mi gnas so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir yul la sogs pa la mi gnas so //
translated: does not abide in objects and so on, because it is devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: chos gang khams gsum na mi gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos gang khams gsum na mi gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: That which does not abide in the three realms

original: sems ni 'dod pa'i khams te /
analyzed: sems ni 'dod pa'i khams te /
translated: is the mind, which is the desire realm,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la mngon par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la mngon par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of being the desire for objects such as form and so on.

original: lus ni gzugs kyi khams te brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rnam par thams cad du so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus ni gzugs kyi khams te brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rnam par thams cad du so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The body is the form realm, because it appears in all aspects, moving and unmoving.

original: ngag ni gzugs med pa'i khams te ngag gi nam mkha' ni gzugs med pa nyid yin pa'i @267b phyir ro //
analyzed: ngag ni gzugs med pa'i khams te ngag gi nam mkha' ni gzugs med pa nyid yin pa'i @267b phyir ro //
translated: Speech is the formless realm, because the space of speech is formless.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i khams gsum na mi gnas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skye ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i khams gsum na mi gnas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skye ba med pa yin no //
translated: Since it does not abide in the three realms, which are like that, it is unborn.

original: rmi lam de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //🔽phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyid sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi mig la sogs pa'i spyod yul gang dag yin pa de rnams kyang rmi lam bzhin du snang ba tsam yin zhing yang dag par na rang bzhin med pa'o snyam du khong du chud par
analyzed: rmi lam de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o // phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyid sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi mig la sogs pa'i spyod yul gang dag yin pa de rnams kyang rmi lam bzhin du snang ba tsam yin zhing yang dag par na rang bzhin med pa'o snyam du khong du chud par
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: bya'o // yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes par zad do //
analyzed: bya'o // yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes par zad do //
translated: With “The eyes, ears, and nose,” and so forth, it should be understood that whatever is the domain of the eyes, and so forth, in the state of waking life, they are mere appearances, like a dream, and in reality they are essenceless.🔽The rest is easy to understand.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, and so forth.

original: stsol to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: stsol to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The verb “is given” is supplied.

original: dngos grub kyi mtshan ma rmi lam rnams dang / de rnam par spyad pa'i chos nyid thos nas shin tu dgyes pa'i spyan gdangs par gyur pas dpal rdo rje 'chang la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: dngos grub kyi mtshan ma rmi lam rnams dang / de rnam par spyad pa'i chos nyid thos nas shin tu dgyes pa'i spyan gdangs par gyur pas dpal rdo rje 'chang la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and the dream signs of spiritual powers, and having heard the reality of their practice, with eyes wide open with great joy, he said this to glorious Vajradhara:

original: gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the verse that begins those who, etc.

original: rjes su 'brang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term following means

original: gang dag la nam mkha'i khams kyi rjes su 'brang zhing kun du khyab pa'i ngang tshul yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag la nam mkha'i khams kyi rjes su 'brang zhing kun du khyab pa'i ngang tshul yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: those who follow the realm of space and have a nature that pervades everywhere are so called.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The qualities of the Buddha are the powers, fearlessnesses, and so forth.

original: rjes su 'brang ba ni mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba ni mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Following means will increase.

original: ngo mtshar zhes bya ba rmad du byung ba'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar zhes bya ba rmad du byung ba'o //
translated: Astonishing means marvelous.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: From there, etc., is easy to understand.

original: sngags thams cad kyi rdo rje'i dngos grub mdo btus pa zhes bya ba ni mi phyed pa'i sngags kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: sngags thams cad kyi rdo rje'i dngos grub mdo btus pa zhes bya ba ni mi phyed pa'i sngags kyi tshogs so //
translated: The summary of the mantra-vajrasiddhi of all mantras is the collection of indivisible mantras.

original: gang la gnas zhes zhus pa na /
analyzed: gang la gnas zhes zhus pa na /
translated: When asked, “Where is it located?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la /
translated: the Blessed One said to all the Tathāgatas:

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: “The Blessed One” and so forth.

original: sngags kyi dngos grub thams cad de /
analyzed: sngags kyi dngos grub thams cad de /
translated: All mantra-vajrasiddhis

original: sngags kyi rdo rje thams cad sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi rdo rje thams cad sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: are not located in the body, speech, and mind of all mantras.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: Why is that? This is the question.

original: lan ni khong nas dbyung bar bya ste /
analyzed: lan ni khong nas dbyung bar bya ste /
translated: The answer is to be drawn out:

original: don dam par 'bras bu la sogs pa rnams dang dngos grub rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par 'bras bu la sogs pa rnams dang dngos grub rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ultimately, the results and so forth and the siddhis are indeed essenceless.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Nevertheless, and so forth.

original: kun rdzob tu dngos grub thams cad dang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rang gi lus dang ngag dang sems la gnas par zhal gyis bzhes nas /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu dngos grub thams cad dang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rang gi lus dang ngag dang sems la gnas par zhal gyis bzhes nas /
translated: Having accepted that all powers and all buddha qualities exist in one's body, speech, and mind on the covering level,

original: slar de gsal ba'i phyir lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽de ni @268a * //
analyzed: slar de gsal ba'i phyir lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / de ni @268a * //
translated: in order to clarify that, he says, body, speech, and mind, and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rab tu rnam par phye ba de'i phyir yang bshad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rab tu rnam par phye ba de'i phyir yang bshad par mi bya'o //
translated: Since that is well analyzed by the Lord himself, it should not be explained again.

original: sems can thams cad kyi dam tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi dam tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The pledge of all sentient beings, and so on.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems chen po ni sems thams cad do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems chen po ni sems thams cad do //
translated: The ultimate great thought of awakening of all sentient beings is all minds.

original: de nyid ni dam tshig ste rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa lha thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni dam tshig ste rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa lha thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu'o //
translated: That itself is the pledge, the cause, because it is the cause of the arising of all deities such as Great Vajradhara.

original: de nyid kyi phyir snying po mi phyed pa 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir snying po mi phyed pa 'byung ba ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is the arising of the indivisible essence.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu'i rang bzhin 'byung ba yin zhing gang las de kun du bshad pa de'i ming can gyi le'u gsungs so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu'i rang bzhin 'byung ba yin zhing gang las de kun du bshad pa de'i ming can gyi le'u gsungs so //
translated: The chapter having that name is spoken, from which all of those are explained.

original: le'u bco lnga pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bco lnga pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: The explanation of the fifteenth chapter is concluded.

original: // / mtshan ma thob pa dang lha dag gis rjes su gnang ba rnams kyis rang gi dkyil 'khor du dngos grub thams cad bsgrub par bya zhing /
analyzed: // / mtshan ma thob pa dang lha dag gis rjes su gnang ba rnams kyis rang gi dkyil 'khor du dngos grub thams cad bsgrub par bya zhing /
translated: Those who have attained the signs and have been authorized by the deities should accomplish all powers in their own maṇḍala,

original: sems can rnams kyang snod du rung bar bya dgos pas /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang snod du rung bar bya dgos pas /
translated: and they should also make sentient beings suitable recipients.

original: de'i phyir dngos grub thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor rdo rje mngon par byang chub pa'i le'u bcu drug pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos grub thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor rdo rje mngon par byang chub pa'i le'u bcu drug pa /
translated: Therefore, the sixteenth chapter is the maṇḍala of all powers, the vajra manifest enlightenment.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then, etc.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni le'u bco lnga po 'dus pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //

original: sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi'o // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: refers to the deities of the body mandala.🔽The body of all the Ones-Gone-Thus is Vairochana.

original: de'i dkyil 'khor ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: His mandala is the body mandala of all the Ones-Gone-Thus.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: gsung rdo rje thams cad ni padma'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor ro //🔽de'i dam @270a * //
analyzed: gsung rdo rje thams cad ni padma'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor ro // de'i dam @270a * //
translated: All vajra speech is the mandala of the lotus family.

original: tshig ni rgyu ste 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: tshig ni rgyu ste 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Its pledge is the cause, which is Amitabha.

original: de'i sprin ni des spros pa'i lha'i 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: de'i sprin ni des spros pa'i lha'i 'khor lo ste /
translated: Its cloud is the divine wheel emanated by it.

original: sprin bzhin du chos kyi char rnams kyis 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don bsgrub pa dang / dkyil 'khor la khyab par byed pa ni yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprin bzhin du chos kyi char rnams kyis 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don bsgrub pa dang / dkyil 'khor la khyab par byed pa ni yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a cloud because it accomplishes the aims of all migrating beings with the rain of Dharma, and because it pervades the mandala.

original: de nyid bkod pa ste gnas la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du bkod pa'i rang bzhin yin zhing ting nge 'dzin gang la ming de skad ces bya ba nyid yod pa de la snyoms par zhugs nas so //
analyzed: de nyid bkod pa ste gnas la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du bkod pa'i rang bzhin yin zhing ting nge 'dzin gang la ming de skad ces bya ba nyid yod pa de la snyoms par zhugs nas so //
translated: That very one is the array, the nature of the array in the abode, etc., and he entered into the meditative stabilization which has just that name.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni thugs la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni thugs la gnas pa ste /
translated: This is the one abiding in the mind.

original: gsum 'dus pa las gsung gi dkyil 'khor phyung ngo //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa las gsung gi dkyil 'khor phyung ngo //
translated: The speech mandala is emitted from the assembly of the three.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'das ma thag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'das ma thag pa bzhin no //
translated: Then, etc. is as just past.

original: gsung gi dkyil 'khor ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: gsung gi dkyil 'khor ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The speech mandala is the mandala of Amitābha.

original: gzhan ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan ni bshad zin to //
translated: The rest has been explained.

original: lha thams cad kyi dbang du byas pa'i sgo nas thun mong yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lha thams cad kyi dbang du byas pa'i sgo nas thun mong yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is common in terms of being taken into the power of all the deities,

original: dkyil 'khor rnams ni kun gyi mchog go //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rnams ni kun gyi mchog go //
translated: is the best of all mandalas.

original: khru ni nyi shu'i tshad du bya //
analyzed: khru ni nyi shu'i tshad du bya //
translated: It should be twenty cubits in size.

original: zhes bya ba ni logs re re zhing khru nyi shu'am lnga yod par ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni logs re re zhing khru nyi shu'am lnga yod par ro //
translated: This means that each side is twenty cubits or five cubits.

original: gru bzhi lham pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gru bzhi lham pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The square, even, and so on, have been explained.

original: rdo rje sgom pa thig gdab po //
analyzed: rdo rje sgom pa thig gdab po //
translated: One should lay out the vajra lines.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa dang gos dkar mo phab pa dang ldan pa'i snod du rang ba gnyis kyis bzung ba'i ji skad bshad pa'i srad bus thig 'debs su bcug ste 'drir gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa dang gos dkar mo phab pa dang ldan pa'i snod du rang ba gnyis kyis bzung ba'i ji skad bshad pa'i srad bus thig 'debs su bcug ste 'drir gzhug pa'o //
translated: This means that one should have two people, one holding a string as described, who are fit to be the receptacles of the descent of the awarenesses of Amitābha and Pāṇḍaravāsinī, lay out the lines and have the painting done.

original: nyid kyi sku'i dkyil 'khor gnas ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: nyid kyi sku'i dkyil 'khor gnas ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The place of the mandala of one’s own body is the mandala of Vairocana.

original: rdo rje sku yi yon tan skyed //
analyzed: rdo rje sku yi yon tan skyed //
translated: It produces the qualities of the vajra body.

original: ces bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad dang / sangs rgyas spyan phab pa dang ldan pa'i snod du rung ba gnyis kyis bris pa ni de'i go 'phang 'thob par byed pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad dang / sangs rgyas spyan phab pa dang ldan pa'i snod du rung ba gnyis kyis bris pa ni de'i go 'phang 'thob par byed pa yin pa'o //
translated: This means that the painting done by two people who are fit to be the receptacles of the awarenesses of Vairocana and Buddhalocanā causes one to attain that state.

original: rgyal po chen po rdo rje chos //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po rdo rje chos //
translated: The great king is Vajradharma.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: This is the previously explained Amitābha.

original: de nyid rig pa gos dkar mo'i bdag po yin pas na rig pa'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: de nyid rig pa gos dkar mo'i bdag po yin pas na rig pa'i bdag po'o //
translated: Since he is the lord of the knowledge goddess Pāṇḍaravāsinī, he is the lord of knowledge.🔽One should cause that to descend,

original: de dbab par bya zhes bya ba ni dkar mo'i zhes bya ba dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i snod du rung ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de dbab par bya zhes bya ba ni dkar mo'i zhes bya ba dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i snod du rung ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: means that one should draw the maṇḍala endowed with Pāṇḍaravāsinī, in the previously explained suitable vessel, which is the second.

original: de dbus 'khor lo chen po ni //
analyzed: de dbus 'khor lo chen po ni //
translated: In the center of that, the great wheel,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa lta bu'i nang gi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa lta bu'i nang gi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: means the inner maṇḍala, like the one just explained.

original: 'on kyang padma'i ka ba brgyad kyis brgyan zhing padma'i phreng bas kun nas bskor ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang padma'i ka ba brgyad kyis brgyan zhing padma'i phreng bas kun nas bskor ba'o //
translated: However, it is adorned with eight lotus pillars and surrounded by a garland of lotuses.

original: phyag rgya thams cad ces bya ba ni sgrub thabs @270b las bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can dkyil 'khor pa'i lha thams cad kyi phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya thams cad ces bya ba ni sgrub thabs @270b las bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can dkyil 'khor pa'i lha thams cad kyi phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: All the mudrā means all the great mudrās of the maṇḍala deities, which have the characteristics explained in the sādhana.

original: cho ga bzhin du bri bar bya //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du bri bar bya //
translated: One should draw them according to the rite.

original: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: This is as before.

original: de yi dbus su gzhag par bya //
analyzed: de yi dbus su gzhag par bya //
translated: One should place it in the center of that.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na gnas pa'i sa'i cha la sna tshogs padma'i steng du padma dmar po la bzhugs pa'i 'od dpag tu med pa'i phyag rgya chen po dang / de kho na bzhin du dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor rnams la ni phyag mtshan gyi phyag rgya ji lta ba bzhin gnas rnams su dgod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na gnas pa'i sa'i cha la sna tshogs padma'i steng du padma dmar po la bzhugs pa'i 'od dpag tu med pa'i phyag rgya chen po dang / de kho na bzhin du dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor rnams la ni phyag mtshan gyi phyag rgya ji lta ba bzhin gnas rnams su dgod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that in the center of the mandala of evocation, on a part of the ground, on a variegated lotus, one should place the great seal of Amitābha, seated on a red lotus, and in the same way, in the places where the insignia seals are situated, one should place the insignia seals of the mandalas of pledge.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas spyan bzhin du gos dkar mor rnam par bsgoms pa'i gar mkhan gyi bu mo'i gzugs lo nyi shu lon pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas spyan bzhin du gos dkar mor rnam par bsgoms pa'i gar mkhan gyi bu mo'i gzugs lo nyi shu lon pa'o //
translated: “That very” means that one should visualize the goddess Pāṇḍaravāsinī, like Buddhalocanā, in the form of a dancing girl, twenty years of age.

original: rdo rje'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par bshad zin to //
analyzed: rdo rje'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par bshad zin to //
translated: The “vajra-places” and so on have been explained.

original: yongs su gsal bar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du gsal bar ro //
analyzed: yongs su gsal bar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du gsal bar ro //
translated: “Clearly” means completely.

original: cho ga bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: cho ga bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: “According to the rite” and so on is taught as follows.

original: thugs rdo rje'i sgrub pa dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dag las gang yang rung ba'i cho ga bzhin dub gsung gi dkyil 'khor mngon par bris la de kho na bzhin du lha rnam par dgod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis de'i dbus kyi gdan la gnas
analyzed: thugs rdo rje'i sgrub pa dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dag las gang yang rung ba'i cho ga bzhin dub gsung gi dkyil 'khor mngon par bris la de kho na bzhin du lha rnam par dgod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis de'i dbus kyi gdan la gnas
translated: In accordance with the ritual of any of the maṇḍalas of the vajra mind and the commitments, one should draw the maṇḍala of the vajra speech, and having first arranged the deities just as they are, one should abide in the yoga of Great Vajradhara on the seat in the center.

original: pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga'i rjes thogs la /
analyzed: pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga'i rjes thogs la /
translated: After the ritual of the consecration of the body, and so on,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i gar mkhan gyi bu mo de kho na bzhin du kun du bzang mor byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i gar mkhan gyi bu mo de kho na bzhin du kun du bzang mor byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: one should consecrate the dancer’s daughter just as she was explained as Samantabhadrī,

original: de dang lhan cig shin tu rnal 'byor gyi ting nge 'dzin la thug pa'i dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting de 'dzin rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig shin tu rnal 'byor gyi ting nge 'dzin la thug pa'i dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting de 'dzin rdzogs par byas te /
translated: and having completed the samādhi of the first union up to the samādhi of the yoga of the two,

original: de'i madma na gnas pa'i byang chub sems kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor las /
analyzed: de'i madma na gnas pa'i byang chub sems kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor las /
translated: one should visualize the maṇḍala of the moon of bodhicitta in one’s heart center.

original: a'a ro lik ces bya ba'i snying po las byung ba rdo rje gsum gyis byin byis brlabs pa'i gsung rdo rje'i sku phyung la /
analyzed: a'a ro lik ces bya ba'i snying po las byung ba rdo rje gsum gyis byin byis brlabs pa'i gsung rdo rje'i sku phyung la /
translated: The speech vajra of the consecration by the three vajras from the essence mantra called “Arolik” is drawn out.

original: de 'dod chags kyi spyod pa can gyi sems cad rnams 'dul du bcug ste /
analyzed: de 'dod chags kyi spyod pa can gyi sems cad rnams 'dul du bcug ste /
translated: It is caused to tame the sentient beings who have the conduct of passion.

original: de kun nas rang gi lus la bcug ste /
analyzed: de kun nas rang gi lus la bcug ste /
translated: That is completely drawn into one’s body.

original: bdag nyid gos dkar mo dang ldan pa'i gsung rdo rjer rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: bdag nyid gos dkar mo dang ldan pa'i gsung rdo rjer rnam par bsams la /
translated: One should imagine oneself as the speech vajra endowed with Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo kun du bsgrubs te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo kun du bsgrubs te /
translated: The entire maṇḍala wheel is accomplished.

original: dzi na dzik ces bya ba la sogs pa'i snying po rnams kyis lha'i 'khor lo phyung la gnas ji lta ba @271a * //
analyzed: dzi na dzik ces bya ba la sogs pa'i snying po rnams kyis lha'i 'khor lo phyung la gnas ji lta ba @271a * //
translated: The deity wheel is drawn out by the essence mantras beginning with “Jinajik.”

original: bzhin du gnas pa rnams la bcug ste /
analyzed: bzhin du gnas pa rnams la bcug ste /
translated: The deities are placed in their respective places.

original: de kho na bzhin du ye shes kyi 'khor lo rjes su bcug la /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du ye shes kyi 'khor lo rjes su bcug la /
translated: The gnosis wheel is completely drawn in just as before.

original: rnal 'byor chen po la gnas par byas nas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po la gnas par byas nas /
translated: Having been caused to abide in the great yoga,

original: shin tu rnal 'byor la gnas pa la dbang bskur te /
analyzed: shin tu rnal 'byor la gnas pa la dbang bskur te /
translated: the consecration is conferred in the yoga of the very subtle.

original: bla na med pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa rnams kyis kun du mchod la /
analyzed: bla na med pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa rnams kyis kun du mchod la /
translated: One should make offerings with the offerings of the unsurpassed, and so on.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i bdud rtsi lngas dkyil 'khor pa mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i bdud rtsi lngas dkyil 'khor pa mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should worship the mandala with the five nectars as explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung gi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung gi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The maṇḍala of the speech of all tathāgatas is as before.

original: lha thams cad kyi thun mong gi sgrub pa dang / dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dag gi nges pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lha thams cad kyi thun mong gi sgrub pa dang / dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dag gi nges pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the common practice of all the deities and the certainty of the maṇḍala of the commitments,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares thereupon, etc.

original: kun du sprin rdo rje ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: kun du sprin rdo rje ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The cloud of vajras is the vajra body, etc.

original: de rnams kyi tshogs ni dkyil 'khor du yang dag par dgod pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi tshogs ni dkyil 'khor du yang dag par dgod pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Their assembly is the nature of the activity of the perfect arrangement in the maṇḍala, etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la ming de skad ces bya ba nyid yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la ming de skad ces bya ba nyid yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That samādhi is so-named because it has that name.

original: gzhan ni rnam par bshad zin to //🔽rdo rje 'dzin mchog gang yin pa'i //
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam par bshad zin to // rdo rje 'dzin mchog gang yin pa'i //
translated: The rest has been explained.🔽The supreme vajra-holder

original: zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: is any one of the vajra body, etc.

original: gzugs ni dbus su legs bris pa /
analyzed: gzugs ni dbus su legs bris pa /
translated: The form is well drawn in the center.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning:

original: thugs dang sku dang gsung gi dkyil 'khor ji skad bshad pa'i tshad la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can rnams las gang yang rung ba'i dbus bdag po'i gnas su //
analyzed: thugs dang sku dang gsung gi dkyil 'khor ji skad bshad pa'i tshad la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can rnams las gang yang rung ba'i dbus bdag po'i gnas su //
translated: In the center of any of the maṇḍalas of mind, body, and speech, which have the characteristics of the previously explained measurements, etc., in the place of the lord,

original: gzugs kun du bris pa'i dkyil 'khor de ni de dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs kun du bris pa'i dkyil 'khor de ni de dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: the form is drawn in the maṇḍala, which is connected with that.

original: de la gang gi tshe /
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe /
translated: There, when

original: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la sku rdo rje 'god par byed pa de'i tshe //
analyzed: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la sku rdo rje 'god par byed pa de'i tshe //
translated: one places Body-vajra in the maṇḍala of mind,

original: dbugs kyi sa'i cha dkar po dang / sku rdo rje'i gnas su sa'i cha sngon po la mi bskyod pa dgod par bya'o //🔽de bzhin du dbus kyi sa'i cha ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu la go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: dbugs kyi sa'i cha dkar po dang / sku rdo rje'i gnas su sa'i cha sngon po la mi bskyod pa dgod par bya'o // de bzhin du dbus kyi sa'i cha ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu la go rims bzhin du /
translated: one should place Akṣobhya in the white part of the breath and in the blue part of the earth in the place of Body-vajra.

original: dkon mchog dpal dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod par grub pa rnams bkod de /
analyzed: dkon mchog dpal dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod par grub pa rnams bkod de /
translated: Similarly, one should place Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi in the yellow, red, and green parts of the earth in the center, respectively.

original: de dang de'i dbus su de kho na bzhin du mi bskyod pa dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dang de'i dbus su de kho na bzhin du mi bskyod pa dgod par bya'o //
translated: And in the center of each of those, one should place Akṣobhya in the same way.

original: m'a ma k'i la sogs pa dkyil 'khor ba'i lha dgod pa'i dus su ni /
analyzed: m'a ma k'i la sogs pa dkyil 'khor ba'i lha dgod pa'i dus su ni /
translated: When arranging the deities of the mandala such as Māmakī,

original: dbus kyi sa'i cha sngon po dang rang gi gnas su de dang mtshungs pa nyid kyi gzugs gnyis pa dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: dbus kyi sa'i cha sngon po dang rang gi gnas su de dang mtshungs pa nyid kyi gzugs gnyis pa dgod par bya'o //
translated: one should arrange two forms in the central part of the earth, blue and similar to one’s own place.

original: 'phags pa 'jam @271b dpal la sogs pa phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor ba rnams sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam @271b dpal la sogs pa phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor ba rnams sam /
translated: The outer deities such as Ārya Mañjuśrī

original: rgyud gzhan dang gzhan las gsungs pa'i lha rnams ni dbus su 'das ma thag pa bzhin du dgod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan dang gzhan las gsungs pa'i lha rnams ni dbus su 'das ma thag pa bzhin du dgod par bya ba'o //
translated: or the deities taught in other tantras and so forth should be arranged in the center as just explained.

original: mi bskyod pa ni m'a ma k'i'i bdag po yin pa'i phyir rang la 'dus so //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa ni m'a ma k'i'i bdag po yin pa'i phyir rang la 'dus so //
translated: Akṣobhya is included in Māmakī because he is the lord of Māmakī.🔽Similarly, when arranging the deities such as Cittavajra and so forth of the body mandala,

original: de bzhin du sku'i dkyil 'khor la thugs rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'god pa'i dus su ni dbus kyi cha kha dog ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du sku'i dkyil 'khor la thugs rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'god pa'i dus su ni dbus kyi cha kha dog ni /
translated: the color of the central part is blue.

original: sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu yin zhing thugs rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gnas su ni sa'i cha dkar po la bzhugs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu yin zhing thugs rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gnas su ni sa'i cha dkar po la bzhugs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad dgod par bya'o //
translated: and blue, yellow, red, and green, and in the places of Akshobhya and so on, the Tathagatas, one should place Vairochana, who is seated on a white part of the earth.

original: de bzhin du spyan la sogs pa 'god pa na dbus kyi sa'i cha dkar po dang sku rdo rje 'du bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du spyan la sogs pa 'god pa na dbus kyi sa'i cha dkar po dang sku rdo rje 'du bar shes par bya'o //
translated: And likewise, when placing Locana and so on, one should know that the central part of the earth is white and that it is the place of Vairochana.

original: de bzhin du gsung gi dkyil 'khor la yang 'das ma thag pa bzhin du rang dang rjes su mthun par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung gi dkyil 'khor la yang 'das ma thag pa bzhin du rang dang rjes su mthun par bya'o //
translated: And likewise, in the mandala of speech, one should do as was just done, in accordance with oneself.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i gnas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i gnas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The place of the body, speech, and mind of all Tathagatas means

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi ji skad bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor gsum bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi ji skad bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor gsum bsgrub pa'o //
translated: the accomplishment of the three mandalas of all Tathagatas and so on, as was explained.

original: gzhan ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan ni bshad zin to //
translated: The rest is self-evident.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi 'khor lo ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang 'brel pa rnams te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi 'khor lo ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang 'brel pa rnams te /
translated: The wheel of all maṇḍalas is those associated with Vairocana, etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la de rnams 'byung ba rdo rje ste skye ba mi phyed pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya zhing de la snyoms par zhugs nas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la de rnams 'byung ba rdo rje ste skye ba mi phyed pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya zhing de la snyoms par zhugs nas so //
translated: That vajra, i.e., indestructible birth, in which they arise in a certain samādhi, is so called, and having entered into union with it,

original: 'di zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid ni bshad zin to //
translated: the characteristic of this has been explained.

original: de la 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In that, this, etc.

original: thugs rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyi dkyil 'khor ni /
analyzed: thugs rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyi dkyil 'khor ni /
translated: The maṇḍala of Cittavajra, etc.

original: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: is the vajra maṇḍala.

original: de thig gdab pa'i phyir snod du rung ba gnyis skyed pa'i sa bon shes pa dang skyob pa'i rang bzhin can 'dod pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa rnams nyid ni sngags kyi snying po'i thig gi yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: de thig gdab pa'i phyir snod du rung ba gnyis skyed pa'i sa bon shes pa dang skyob pa'i rang bzhin can 'dod pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa rnams nyid ni sngags kyi snying po'i thig gi yi ge rnams so //
translated: The syllables of the essence mantra of those who are fit vessels for the creation of the seed of the generation of the two, who have the nature of knowledge and protection, and who cause the attainment of the fruit of desire, are the syllables of the thread of the essence mantra.

original: de la thugs rdo rje bsgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i phyi rol du bcu gnyis lon pa'i khye'u dang bu mo dang yi ge h'um gis mi bskyod pa dang m'a ma k'ir bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de la thugs rdo rje bsgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i phyi rol du bcu gnyis lon pa'i khye'u dang bu mo dang yi ge h'um gis mi bskyod pa dang m'a ma k'ir bskyed par bya'o //
translated: In that, outside the maṇḍala for accomplishing the mind vajra, one should generate a twelve-year-old boy and girl with the syllable hūṃ as Akṣobhya and Māmakī.

original: de bzhin du yi ge aom gyis rnam par snang mdzad dang spyan dang / de bzhin du yi ge a'a: yis 'od dpag tu med pa dang gos dkar mor bskyed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du yi ge aom gyis rnam par snang mdzad dang spyan dang / de bzhin du yi ge a'a: yis 'od dpag tu med pa dang gos dkar mor bskyed la /
translated: Similarly, with the syllable oṃ one should generate Vairocana and Locanā, and likewise with the syllable āḥ one should generate Amitābha and Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: de dag @272a * //
analyzed: de dag @272a * //
translated: Those

original: dkyil 'khor te ji skad bshad pa'i srad bus thig 'debs su bcug la 'drir gzhug ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor te ji skad bshad pa'i srad bus thig 'debs su bcug la 'drir gzhug ste /
translated: are the maṇḍala. Having caused them to draw the lines with the thread as explained, one should have them drawn.

original: rang nyid kyis ma yin no zhes bya ba de nyid bstan pa'i phyir //🔽sngags kyi sems dpas mi bya ste //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis ma yin no zhes bya ba de nyid bstan pa'i phyir // sngags kyi sems dpas mi bya ste //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽gang la sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / gang la sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i sems dpa' ste /
translated: it is said, “The mantra hero should not do it.”🔽The mantra hero is

original: sems yod pa de ni sngags kyi sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: sems yod pa de ni sngags kyi sems dpa' ste /
translated: one who has a mind consecrated by mantra.

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa bsgom pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas mthu thob pa des so //
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa bsgom pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas mthu thob pa des so //
translated: By means of the attainment of power through meditation on the subtle yoga and so forth.

original: rang gis byas na nyes pa ci yod ce na /🔽de'i phyir / byas na byang chub rnyed par dka' //
analyzed: rang gis byas na nyes pa ci yod ce na / de'i phyir / byas na byang chub rnyed par dka' //
translated: What is the fault if one does it oneself?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so ;
translated: If one does it, enlightenment is difficult to attain.

original: / sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor la rang nyid kyis thig gdab pa la sogs pa bkag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: / sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor la rang nyid kyis thig gdab pa la sogs pa bkag pa yin gyi /
translated: It is prohibited that one should oneself lay out the maṇḍala of practice by laying out the lines and so forth,

original: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor la ni ma yin te /
translated: but not the maṇḍala of commitment.

original: thig gdab pa yi cho ga 'di //
analyzed: thig gdab pa yi cho ga 'di //
translated: This rite of laying out the lines

original: bdag nyid gang tshe spyod pa na //
analyzed: bdag nyid gang tshe spyod pa na //
translated: is when one practices oneself.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it will be explained.

original: de bas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na'o //
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na'o //
translated: Therefore means because it is so.

original: dam tshig tshul shes pas te sgrub pa pos so //
analyzed: dam tshig tshul shes pas te sgrub pa pos so //
translated: One who knows the method of commitment is the practitioner.

original: sngags kyi lha rnams phab nas su //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngags kyi lha rnams phab nas su //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having brought down the mantra deities,

original: bshad ma thag pa'i yi ge h'um la sogs pas bskyed pa rang gi rig ma dang ldan pa'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gnyis po rnams la snga ma bzhin du ye shes kyi lha gnyis dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i yi ge h'um la sogs pas bskyed pa rang gi rig ma dang ldan pa'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gnyis po rnams la snga ma bzhin du ye shes kyi lha gnyis dbab par bya'o //
translated: The two, endowed with the knowledge consorts generated by the previously mentioned syllables such as hūṃ, and having the nature of Akṣobhya, and so on, should be caused to descend, as before, with the two gnostics.

original: byin gyis brlab pa'i gnas bsgoms la //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa'i gnas bsgoms la //
translated: Having meditated on the place of consecration,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phung po la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa la thug par byas la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phung po la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa la thug par byas la /
translated: and so on, one should perform the consecration of the aggregates and so on up to the consecration of the body and so on.

original: rim pa yang snga ma bzhin du mngon par 'dus bya'o ;
analyzed: rim pa yang snga ma bzhin du mngon par 'dus bya'o ;
translated: The sequence is to be accomplished as before.

original: / dkyil 'khor rnams ni rnam par brtag / ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: / dkyil 'khor rnams ni rnam par brtag / ces bya ba ni /
translated: The maṇḍalas are imagined.

original: thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams brtag pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams brtag pa'o //
translated: The maṇḍalas of the sādhana are imagined, such as Vajra Mind and so on.

original: dbab par bya ba'i lha nyid ni //
analyzed: dbab par bya ba'i lha nyid ni //
translated: The deity to be caused to descend

original: rgyal chen rnam par snang mdzad dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyal chen rnam par snang mdzad dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: is the Great King Vairocana, and so on.

original: sku'i dkyil 'khor te brten pa'i 'khor lo'i gnas dang rten ni sku'i dkyil 'khor gnas so //
analyzed: sku'i dkyil 'khor te brten pa'i 'khor lo'i gnas dang rten ni sku'i dkyil 'khor gnas so //
translated: The body mandala is the place and support of the supported wheel.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi go 'phang thob par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi go 'phang thob par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it causes the attainment of the state of Vairocana,

original: rdo rje sku yi yon tan 'thob bo //
analyzed: rdo rje sku yi yon tan 'thob bo //
translated: one obtains the qualities of the vajra body.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: This and so on are easy to understand.

original: sngags kyi sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngags kyi sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The mantra hero is

original: sngags kyi mthu 'thob pas @272b so ;
analyzed: sngags kyi mthu 'thob pas @272b so ;
translated: the one who obtains the power of mantra.

original: / rdo rje gsang ba ni lhas bris pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: / rdo rje gsang ba ni lhas bris pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The vajra secret is the mandala drawn by the deities.

original: de nyid shin tu ngo mtshar bar gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rmad po che'o //
analyzed: de nyid shin tu ngo mtshar bar gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rmad po che'o //
translated: That itself is a great wonder because it is truly amazing.

original: khro bo'i rgyal pos zhes bya ba ni dpal gnod mdzes rgyal pos so //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal pos zhes bya ba ni dpal gnod mdzes rgyal pos so //
translated: The king of wrath is glorious Acala.

original: 'di skad du thugs rdo rje la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i dkyil 'khor du /
analyzed: 'di skad du thugs rdo rje la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i dkyil 'khor du /
translated: This is saying that in any mandala of the vajra mind and so on,

original: de'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa kho nas ji lta ba bzhin gnas rnams su lha'i 'khor lo rnam par bkod pa'i rjes thogs la snga ma bzhin du gnod mdzes rgyal po phyung ste /
analyzed: de'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa kho nas ji lta ba bzhin gnas rnams su lha'i 'khor lo rnam par bkod pa'i rjes thogs la snga ma bzhin du gnod mdzes rgyal po phyung ste /
translated: Just by possessing this yoga, one should, in the same way, extract the king of the fierce ones in the places, immediately after the array of the wheel of deities, as before.

original: nges ye shes sems dpa' bkug la /
analyzed: nges ye shes sems dpa' bkug la /
translated: One should summon the gnosis being,

original: dam tshig gi lha rnams kyi thugs kar bcug ste /
analyzed: dam tshig gi lha rnams kyi thugs kar bcug ste /
translated: and place it in the heart of the commitment being deities.

original: rnal 'byor chen po dang shin tu rnal 'byor la gnas pa'i lha'i 'khor lo la bla na med pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa rnams kyis mchod par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po dang shin tu rnal 'byor la gnas pa'i lha'i 'khor lo la bla na med pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa rnams kyis mchod par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: One should worship the wheel of deities abiding in the great yoga and the yoga of highest yoga and so forth with the offerings of the highest yoga and so forth.

original: dam tshig mchod pa dus gsum pa //
analyzed: dam tshig mchod pa dus gsum pa //
translated: The worship of commitment is the three times.

original: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor du rang gi rig ma dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i mchod pa dus gsum du bya pa'o ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor du rang gi rig ma dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i mchod pa dus gsum du bya pa'o ;
translated: The worship of commitment is the worship of one's knowledge consort in the mandala, performed three times.

original: / gang gi zhe na /
analyzed: / gang gi zhe na /
translated: By whom?🔽By the three vajra stainless ones.

original: rdo rje dri med gsum dag gi / zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i rnal 'byor ba bdag nyid kyi'i'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dri med gsum dag gi / zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i rnal 'byor ba bdag nyid kyi'i'o //
translated: The three times are the three vajras.

original: rdo rje gsum gyi sbyor bas zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi sbyor bas zhes bya bas ni /
translated: By the yoga of the three vajras

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs dang mi phyed par dmigs pas so //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs dang mi phyed par dmigs pas so //
translated: means by visualizing the body, speech, and mind as inseparable.

original: sngags kyi dngos grub thob par byed //
analyzed: sngags kyi dngos grub thob par byed //
translated: One attains the powers of the mantra.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: means
